methods.name: getDayOfYear
methods.desc: Get the numeric day number of the year, adjusted for leap year.

methods.name: getDaysInMonth
methods.desc: Get the number of days in the current month, adjusted for leap year.

methods.name: getElapsed
methods.desc: Returns the number of milliseconds between this date and date

methods.name: getFirstDateOfMonth
methods.desc: Get the first date of this date's month

methods.name: getFirstDayOfMonth
methods.desc:
Get the first day of the current month, adjusted for leap year. The returned value is the numeric day index within the week (0-6) which can be used in conjunction with the {@link #monthNames} array to retrieve the textual day name. Example: 

var dt = new Date('1/10/2007');
document.write(Date.dayNames[dt.getFirstDayOfMonth()]); //output: 'Monday'

methods.name: getGMTColonOffset
methods.desc: Get the offset from GMT of the current date (equivalent to the format specifier 'P').

methods.name: getGMTOffset
methods.desc: Get the offset from GMT of the current date (equivalent to the format specifier 'O').

methods.name: getLastDateOfMonth
methods.desc: Get the last date of this date's month

methods.name: getLastDayOfMonth
methods.desc:
Get the last day of the current month, adjusted for leap year. The returned value is the numeric day index within the week (0-6) which can be used in conjunction with the {@link #monthNames} array to retrieve the textual day name. Example: 

var dt = new Date('1/10/2007');
document.write(Date.dayNames[dt.getLastDayOfMonth()]); //output: 'Wednesday'

methods.name: getSuffix
methods.desc: Get the English ordinal suffix of the current day (equivalent to the format specifier 'S').

methods.name: getTimezone
methods.desc: Get the timezone abbreviation of the current date (equivalent to the format specifier 'T').

methods.name: getWeekOfYear
methods.desc:
Get the string representation of the numeric week number of the year
(equivalent to the format specifier 'W').

methods.name: isLeapYear
methods.desc: Whether or not the current date is in a leap year.

methods.name: parseDate
createCallback
methods.desc: Creates a callback that passes arguments[0], arguments[1], arguments[2], ... Call directly on any function. Example: myFunction.createCallback(myarg, myarg2) Will create a function that is bound to those 2 args.

methods.name: createDelegate
methods.desc: Creates a delegate (callback) that sets the scope to obj. Call directly on any function. Example: this.myFunction.createDelegate(this) Will create a function that is automatically scoped to this.

methods.name: createInterceptor
methods.desc:
Creates an interceptor function. The passed fcn is called before the original one. If it returns false, the original one is not called.
The resulting function returns the results of the original function.
The passed fcn is called with the parameters of the original function.

methods.name: createSequence
methods.desc:
Create a combined function call sequence of the original function + the passed function.
The resulting function returns the results of the original function.
The passed fcn is called with the parameters of the original function

methods.name: defer
methods.sig: (Number millis, Object obj, Array args, Boolean/Number appendArgs)
methods.desc: Calls this function after the number of millseconds specified.

methods.name: constrain
methods.desc:
Checks whether or not the current number is within a desired range.  If the number is already within the
range it is returned, otherwise the min or max value is returned depending on which side of the range is
exceeded.  Note that this method returns the constrained value but does not change the current number.

methods.name: addBehaviors

methods.name: each
methods.desc:
Iterates an array calling the passed function with each item, stopping if your function returns false. If the
passed array is not really an array, your function is called once with it.
The supplied function is called with (Object item, Number index, Array allItems).

methods.name: selectNode
methods.desc:
Selects a single element as a Roo Element
This is about as close as you can get to jQuery's $('do crazy stuff')

methods.name: type
methods.desc:
Returns the type of object that is passed in. If the object passed in is null or undefined it return false otherwise it returns one of the following values:
  • string: If the object passed is a string
  • number: If the object passed is a number
  • boolean: If the object passed is a boolean value
  • function: If the object passed is a function reference
  • object: If the object passed is an object
  • array: If the object passed is an array
  • regexp: If the object passed is a regular expression
  • element: If the object passed is a DOM Element
  • nodelist: If the object passed is a DOM NodeList
  • textnode: If the object passed is a DOM text node and contains something other than whitespace
  • whitespace: If the object passed is a DOM text node and contains only whitespace

methods.name: urlDecode
methods.desc: Takes an encoded URL and and converts it to an object. e.g. Roo.urlDecode("foo=1&bar=2"); would return {foo: 1, bar: 2} or Roo.urlDecode("foo=1&bar=2&bar=3&bar=4", true); would return {foo: 1, bar: [2, 3, 4]}.

methods.name: urlEncode
methods.desc: Takes an object and converts it to an encoded URL. e.g. Roo.urlEncode({foo: 1, bar: 2}); would return "foo=1&bar=2".  Optionally, property values can be arrays, instead of keys and the resulting string that's returned will contain a name/value pair for each array value.

props.name: url
props.desc: The default URL to be used for requests to the server. (defaults to undefined)

props.name: extraParams
props.desc: An object containing properties which are used as extra parameters to each request made by this object. (defaults to undefined)

props.name: defaultHeaders
props.desc: An object containing request headers which are added to each request made by this object. (defaults to undefined)

props.name: method
props.desc: (Optional)  The default HTTP method to be used for requests. (defaults to undefined; if not set but parms are present will use POST, otherwise GET)

props.name: timeout
props.desc: (Optional) The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests. (defaults to 30000)

props.name: autoAbort
props.desc: (Optional) Whether a new request should abort any pending requests. (defaults to false)

props.name: disableCaching
props.desc: (Optional)   True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests. (defaults to true)

Fires if an error HTTP status was returned from the server.
See {@link http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html} for details of HTTP status codes.

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc: True to auto create from scratch, or using a DomHelper Object (defaults to false)

props.name: title
props.desc: Default text to display in the title bar (defaults to null)

props.name: width
props.desc: Width of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: height
props.desc: Height of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: x
props.desc: The default left page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: y
props.desc: The default top page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: animateTarget
props.desc:
Id or element from which the dialog should animate while opening
(defaults to null with no animation)

props.name: resizable
props.desc: False to disable manual dialog resizing (defaults to true)

props.name: resizeHandles
props.desc:
Which resize handles to display - see the {@link Roo.Resizable} handles config
property for valid values (defaults to 'all')

props.name: minHeight
props.desc: The minimum allowable height for a resizable dialog (defaults to 80)

props.name: minWidth
props.desc: The minimum allowable width for a resizable dialog (defaults to 200)

props.name: modal
props.desc: True to show the dialog modally, preventing user interaction with the rest of the page (defaults to false)

props.name: autoScroll
props.desc: True to allow the dialog body contents to overflow and display scrollbars (defaults to false)

props.name: closable
props.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner close button (defaults to true)

props.name: collapsible
props.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner collapse button (defaults to true)

props.name: constraintoviewport
props.desc: True to keep the dialog constrained within the visible viewport boundaries (defaults to true)

props.name: syncHeightBeforeShow
props.desc: True to cause the dimensions to be recalculated before the dialog is shown (defaults to false)

props.name: draggable
props.desc: False to disable dragging of the dialog within the viewport (defaults to true)

props.name: autoTabs
props.desc: If true, all elements with class 'x-dlg-tab' will get automatically converted to tabs (defaults to false)

props.name: tabTag
props.desc: The tag name of tab elements, used when autoTabs = true (defaults to 'div')

props.name: proxyDrag
props.desc:
True to drag a lightweight proxy element rather than the dialog itself, used when
draggable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: fixedcenter
props.desc: True to ensure that anytime the dialog is shown or resized it gets centered (defaults to false)

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right
shadow (defaults to false)

props.name: shadowOffset
props.desc: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 5)

props.name: buttonAlign
props.desc: Valid values are "left," "center" and "right" (defaults to "right")

props.name: minButtonWidth
props.desc: Minimum width of all dialog buttons (defaults to 75)

props.name: buttons
props.desc: Array of buttons

props.name: shim
props.desc: True to create an iframe shim that prevents selects from showing through (defaults to false)

props.name: menuAlign
props.desc: The position to align the menu to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to 'tl-bl?').

props.desc: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button (defaults to undefined).

props.desc: The button's type, corresponding to the DOM input element type attribute.  Either "submit," "reset" or "button" (default).

props.name: clickEvent
props.desc: The type of event to map to the button's event handler (defaults to 'click')

props.name: handleMouseEvents
props.desc: False to disable visual cues on mouseover, mouseout and mousedown (defaults to true)

props.name: tooltipType
props.desc: The type of tooltip to use. Either "qtip" (default) for QuickTips or "title" for title attribute.

props.name: template
props.desc:
(Optional)
An {@link Roo.Template} with which to create the Button's main element. This Template must
contain numeric substitution parameter 0 if it is to display the tRoo property. Changing the template could
require code modifications if required elements (e.g. a button) aren't present.

props.desc: Maximum allowable date (JavaScript date object, defaults to null)

props.desc: The error text to display if the minDate validation fails (defaults to "This date is before the minimum date")

props.desc: The error text to display if the maxDate validation fails (defaults to "This date is after the maximum date")

The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support.  The format must be
valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'm/d/y').

props.desc: An array of days to disable, 0-based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

props.desc: JavaScript regular expression used to disable a pattern of dates (defaults to null)

props.name: prevText

methods.name: alignTo
methods.sig: (String/HTMLElement/Roo.Element element, String position, Array offsets, Boolean/Object animate)
methods.desc:
Aligns this element with another element relative to the specified anchor points. If the other element is the document it aligns it to the viewport. The position parameter is optional, and can be specified in any one of the following formats:
  • Blank: Defaults to aligning the element's top-left corner to the target's bottom-left corner ("tl-bl").
  • One anchor (deprecated): The passed anchor position is used as the target element's anchor point. The element being aligned will position its top-left corner (tl) to that point. This method has been deprecated in favor of the newer two anchor syntax below.
  • Two anchors: If two values from the table below are passed separated by a dash, the first value is used as the element's anchor point, and the second value is used as the target's anchor point.
In addition to the anchor points, the position parameter also supports the "?" character. If "?" is passed at the end of the position string, the element will attempt to align as specified, but the position will be adjusted to constrain to the viewport if necessary. Note that the element being aligned might be swapped to align to a different position than that specified in order to enforce the viewport constraints. Following are all of the supported anchor positions: 
    Value  Description
    -----  -----------------------------
    tl     The top left corner (default)
    t      The center of the top edge
    tr     The top right corner
    l      The center of the left edge
    c      In the center of the element
    r      The center of the right edge
    bl     The bottom left corner
    b      The center of the bottom edge
    br     The bottom right corner
Example Usage: 

    // align el to other-el using the default positioning ("tl-bl", non-constrained)
    el.alignTo("other-el");

    // align the top left corner of el with the top right corner of other-el (constrained to viewport)
    el.alignTo("other-el", "tr?");

    // align the bottom right corner of el with the center left edge of other-el
    el.alignTo("other-el", "br-l?");

    // align the center of el with the bottom left corner of other-el and
    // adjust the x position by -6 pixels (and the y position by 0)
    el.alignTo("other-el", "c-bl", [-6, 0]);

methods.name: hasFxBlock
methods.desc:
Returns true if the element is currently blocking so that no other effect can be queued
until this effect is finished, else returns false if blocking is not set.  This is commonly
used to ensure that an effect initiated by a user action runs to completion prior to the
same effect being restarted (e.g., firing only one effect even if the user clicks several times).

methods.name: highlight

methods.name: puff
scale

methods.desc:
Ensures that all effects queued after sequenceFx is called on the element are
run in sequence.  This is the opposite of {@link #syncFx}.

methods.name: shift
slideIn
slideOut
stopFx
methods.desc:
Stops any running effects and clears the element's internal effects queue if it contains
any additional effects that haven't started yet.

methods.name: switchOff
syncFx
methods.desc:
Ensures that all effects queued after syncFx is called on the element are
run concurrently.  This is the opposite of {@link #sequenceFx}.

props.desc: False to disable constrain to viewport (defaults to true)

props.name: cls
props.desc: CSS class to add to the element

props.name: zindex
props.desc: Starting z-index (defaults to 11000)

props.name: shadowOffset
props.desc: Number of pixels to offset the shadow (defaults to 3)

methods.name: addClass
methods.desc: Adds one or more CSS classes to the element. Duplicate classes are automatically filtered out.

methods.name: addClassOnClick
methods.desc: Sets up event handlers to add and remove a css class when the mouse is down and then up on this element (a click effect)

methods.name: addClassOnFocus
methods.desc: Sets up event handlers to add and remove a css class when this element has the focus

methods.name: addClassOnOver
methods.desc: Sets up event handlers to add and remove a css class when the mouse is over this element

methods.name: addKeyListener
methods.desc: Convenience method for constructing a KeyMap

methods.name: addKeyMap
methods.desc: Creates a KeyMap for this element

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function fn, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler

methods.name: alignTo
methods.sig: (String/HTMLElement/Roo.Element element, String position, Array offsets, Boolean/Object animate)
methods.desc:
Aligns this element with another element relative to the specified anchor points. If the other element is the document it aligns it to the viewport. The position parameter is optional, and can be specified in any one of the following formats:
  • Blank: Defaults to aligning the element's top-left corner to the target's bottom-left corner ("tl-bl").
  • One anchor (deprecated): The passed anchor position is used as the target element's anchor point. The element being aligned will position its top-left corner (tl) to that point. This method has been deprecated in favor of the newer two anchor syntax below.
  • Two anchors: If two values from the table below are passed separated by a dash, the first value is used as the element's anchor point, and the second value is used as the target's anchor point.
In addition to the anchor points, the position parameter also supports the "?" character. If "?" is passed at the end of the position string, the element will attempt to align as specified, but the position will be adjusted to constrain to the viewport if necessary. Note that the element being aligned might be swapped to align to a different position than that specified in order to enforce the viewport constraints. Following are all of the supported anchor positions: 
    Value  Description
    -----  -----------------------------
    tl     The top left corner (default)
    t      The center of the top edge
    tr     The top right corner
    l      The center of the left edge
    c      In the center of the element
    r      The center of the right edge
    bl     The bottom left corner
    b      The center of the bottom edge
    br     The bottom right corner
Example Usage: 

    // align el to other-el using the default positioning ("tl-bl", non-constrained)
    el.alignTo("other-el");

    // align the top left corner of el with the top right corner of other-el (constrained to viewport)
    el.alignTo("other-el", "tr?");

    // align the bottom right corner of el with the center left edge of other-el
    el.alignTo("other-el", "br-l?");

    // align the center of el with the bottom left corner of other-el and
    // adjust the x position by -6 pixels (and the y position by 0)
    el.alignTo("other-el", "c-bl", [-6, 0]);

methods.name: anchorTo
methods.sig: (String/HTMLElement/Roo.Element element, String position, Array offsets, Boolean/Object animate, Boolean/Number monitorScroll, Function callback)
methods.desc: Anchors an element to another element and realigns it when the window is resized.

methods.name: animate
methods.sig: (Object args, Float duration, Function onComplete, String easing, String animType)
methods.desc: Perform animation on this element.

methods.name: appendChild
methods.desc: Appends the passed element(s) to this element

methods.name: appendTo
methods.desc: Appends this element to the passed element

methods.name: applyStyles
methods.desc: More flexible version of {@link #setStyle} for setting style properties.

methods.name: attr
methods.desc: Sets or Returns the value the dom attribute value

methods.name: autoHeight
methods.sig: (Boolean animate, Float duration, Function onComplete, String easing)
methods.desc:
Measures the element's content height and updates height to match. Note: this function uses setTimeout so
the new height may not be available immediately.

methods.name: beginMeasure
methods.desc: Temporarily enables offsets (width,height,x,y) for an element with display:none, use endMeasure() when done.

methods.name: blur
methods.desc: Tries to blur the element. Any exceptions are caught and ignored.

methods.name: boxWrap
methods.desc:
Wraps the specified element with a special markup/CSS block that renders by default as a gray container with a
gradient background, rounded corners and a 4-way shadow.

methods.name: center
methods.desc: Centers the Element in either the viewport, or another Element.

methods.name: child
methods.desc: Selects a single child at any depth below this element based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

methods.name: clean
methods.desc: Removes worthless text nodes

methods.name: clearOpacity
methods.desc: Clears any opacity settings from this element. Required in some cases for IE.

methods.name: clearPositioning
methods.desc: Clear positioning back to the default when the document was loaded

methods.name: clip
methods.desc: Store the current overflow setting and clip overflow on the element - use {@link #unclip} to remove

methods.name: contains
methods.desc: Returns true if this element is an ancestor of the passed element

methods.name: createChild
methods.desc: Creates the passed DomHelper config and appends it to this element or optionally inserts it before the passed child element.

methods.name: createProxy
methods.desc: Creates a proxy element of this element

methods.name: createShim
methods.desc:
Creates an iframe shim for this element to keep selects and other windowed objects from
showing through.

methods.name: down
methods.desc: Selects a single *direct* child based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

methods.name: enableDisplayMode
methods.desc: Convenience method for setVisibilityMode(Element.DISPLAY)

methods.name: endMeasure
methods.desc: Restores displays to before beginMeasure was called

methods.name: findParent
methods.desc: Looks at this node and then at parent nodes for a match of the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child)

methods.name: findParentNode
methods.desc: Looks at parent nodes for a match of the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child)

methods.name: fitToParent
methods.desc:
Sizes this element to its parent element's dimensions performing
neccessary box adjustments.

methods.name: fly
methods.desc:
Gets the globally shared flyweight Element, with the passed node as the active element. Do not store a reference to this element -
the dom node can be overwritten by other code.

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Tries to focus the element. Any exceptions are caught and ignored.

methods.name: get
methods.desc:
Static method to retrieve Element objects. Uses simple caching to consistently return the same object.
Automatically fixes if an object was recreated with the same id via AJAX or DOM.

methods.name: getAlignToXY
methods.desc:
Gets the x,y coordinates to align this element with another element. See {@link #alignTo} for more info on the
supported position values.

methods.name: getAnchorXY
methods.desc: Gets the x,y coordinates specified by the anchor position on the element.

methods.name: getAttributeNS
methods.desc: Returns the value of a namespaced attribute from the element's underlying DOM node.

methods.name: getBorderWidth
methods.desc: Gets the width of the border(s) for the specified side(s)

methods.name: getBottom
methods.desc: Gets the bottom Y coordinate of the element (element Y position + element height)

methods.name: getBox
methods.desc:
Return a box {x, y, width, height} that can be used to set another elements
size/location to match this element.

methods.name: getCenterXY
methods.desc: Calculates the x, y to center this element on the screen

methods.name: getColor
methods.desc:
Return the CSS color for the specified CSS attribute. rgb, 3 digit (like #fff) and valid values
are convert to standard 6 digit hex color.

methods.name: getComputedHeight
methods.desc:
Returns either the offsetHeight or the height of this element based on CSS height adjusted by padding or borders
when needed to simulate offsetHeight when offsets aren't available. This may not work on display:none elements
if a height has not been set using CSS.

methods.name: getComputedWidth
methods.desc:
Returns either the offsetWidth or the width of this element based on CSS width adjusted by padding or borders
when needed to simulate offsetWidth when offsets aren't available. This may not work on display:none elements
if a width has not been set using CSS.

methods.name: getFrameWidth
methods.desc:
Returns the sum width of the padding and borders for the passed "sides". See getBorderWidth()
         for more information about the sides.

methods.name: getHeight
methods.desc: Returns the offset height of the element

methods.name: getLeft
methods.desc: Gets the left X coordinate

methods.name: getMargins
methods.desc:
Returns an object with properties top, left, right and bottom representing the margins of this element unless sides is passed,
then it returns the calculated width of the sides (see getPadding)

methods.name: getNextSibling
methods.desc: Gets the next sibling, skipping text nodes

methods.name: getPadding
methods.desc: Gets the width of the padding(s) for the specified side(s)

methods.name: getPositioning
methods.desc:
Gets an object with all CSS positioning properties. Useful along with setPostioning to get
snapshot before performing an update and then restoring the element.

methods.name: getPrevSibling
methods.desc: Gets the previous sibling, skipping text nodes

methods.name: getRegion
methods.desc:
Returns the region of the given element.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have a region (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: getRight
methods.desc: Gets the right X coordinate of the element (element X position + element width)

methods.name: getScroll
methods.desc: Returns the current scroll position of the element.

methods.name: getSize
methods.desc: Returns the size of the element.

methods.name: getStyle
methods.desc: Normalizes currentStyle and computedStyle. This is not YUI getStyle, it is an optimised version.

methods.name: getStyles
methods.desc:
Returns an object with properties matching the styles requested.
For example, el.getStyles('color', 'font-size', 'width') might return
{'color': '#FFFFFF', 'font-size': '13px', 'width': '100px'}.

methods.name: getTop
methods.desc: Gets the top Y coordinate

methods.name: getUpdateManager
methods.desc: Gets this element's UpdateManager

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Returns the value of the "value" attribute

methods.name: getViewSize
methods.desc: Returns the width and height of the viewport.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.desc: Returns the offset width of the element

methods.name: getX
methods.desc: Gets the current X position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: getXY
methods.desc: Gets the current position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: getY
methods.desc: Gets the current Y position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: hasClass
methods.desc: Checks if the specified CSS class exists on this element's DOM node.

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide this element - Uses display mode to determine whether to use "display" or "visibility". See {@link #setVisible}.

methods.name: initDD
methods.desc: Initializes a {@link Roo.dd.DD} drag drop object for this element.

methods.name: initDDProxy
methods.desc: Initializes a {@link Roo.dd.DDProxy} object for this element.

methods.name: initDDTarget
methods.desc: Initializes a {@link Roo.dd.DDTarget} object for this element.

methods.name: insertAfter
methods.desc: Inserts this element after the passed element in the DOM

methods.name: insertBefore
methods.desc: Inserts this element before the passed element in the DOM

methods.name: insertFirst
methods.desc: Inserts (or creates) an element (or DomHelper config) as the first child of the this element

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.desc: Inserts an html fragment into this element

methods.name: insertSibling
methods.desc: Inserts (or creates) the passed element (or DomHelper config) as a sibling of this element

methods.name: is
methods.desc: Returns true if this element matches the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child)

methods.name: isBorderBox
methods.desc: Tests various css rules/browsers to determine if this element uses a border box

methods.name: isDisplayed
methods.desc: Returns true if display is not "none"

methods.name: isMasked
methods.desc: Returns true if this element is masked

methods.name: isScrollable
methods.desc: Returns true if this element is scrollable.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Checks whether the element is currently visible using both visibility and display properties.

methods.name: load
methods.sig: (String/Function url, String/Object params, Function callback, Boolean discardUrl)
methods.desc: Direct access to the UpdateManager update() method (takes the same parameters).

methods.name: mask
methods.desc:
Puts a mask over this element to disable user interaction. Requires core.css.
This method can only be applied to elements which accept child nodes.

methods.name: move
methods.desc: Move this element relative to its current position.

methods.name: moveTo
methods.desc:
Sets the position of the element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function fn, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler (Shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: position
methods.sig: (String pos, Number zIndex, Number x, Number y)
methods.desc:
Initializes positioning on this element. If a desired position is not passed, it will make the
the element positioned relative IF it is not already positioned.

methods.name: query
methods.desc: Selects child nodes based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

methods.name: radioClass
methods.desc: Adds one or more CSS classes to this element and removes the same class(es) from all siblings.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Removes this element from the DOM and deletes it from the cache

methods.name: removeAllListeners
methods.desc: Removes all previous added listeners from this element

methods.name: removeClass
methods.desc: Removes one or more CSS classes from the element.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes an event handler from this element

methods.name: repaint
methods.desc: Forces the browser to repaint this element

methods.name: replace
methods.desc: Replaces the passed element with this element

methods.name: replaceClass
methods.desc: Replaces a CSS class on the element with another.  If the old name does not exist, the new name will simply be added.

methods.name: scroll
methods.desc:
Scrolls this element the specified direction. Does bounds checking to make sure the scroll is
within this element's scrollable range.

methods.name: scrollIntoView
methods.desc: Scrolls this element into view within the passed container.

methods.name: scrollTo
methods.desc: Scrolls this element the specified scroll point. It does NOT do bounds checking so if you scroll to a weird value it will try to do it. For auto bounds checking, use scroll().

methods.name: select
methods.desc: Creates a {@link Roo.CompositeElement} for child nodes based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

methods.name: set
methods.desc: Sets the passed attributes as attributes of this element (a style attribute can be a string, object or function)

methods.name: setBottom
methods.desc: Sets the element's CSS bottom style.

methods.name: setBounds
methods.sig: (Number x, Number y, Number width, Number height, Boolean/Object animate)
methods.desc: Sets the element's position and size in one shot. If animation is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

methods.name: setBox
methods.desc: Sets the element's box. Use getBox() on another element to get a box obj. If animate is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

methods.name: setDisplayed
methods.desc: Sets the CSS display property. Uses originalDisplay if the specified value is a boolean true.

methods.name: setHeight
methods.desc: Set the height of the element

methods.name: setLeft
methods.desc: Sets the element's left position directly using CSS style (instead of {@link #setX}).

methods.name: setLeftTop
methods.desc: Quick set left and top adding default units

methods.name: setLocation
methods.desc:
Sets the position of the element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: setOpacity
methods.desc: Set the opacity of the element

methods.name: setPositioning
methods.desc: Set positioning with an object returned by getPositioning().

methods.name: setRegion
methods.desc: Sets the element's position and size the the specified region. If animation is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

methods.name: setRight
methods.desc: Sets the element's CSS right style.

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc: Set the size of the element. If animation is true, both width an height will be animated concurrently.

methods.name: setStyle
methods.desc: Wrapper for setting style properties, also takes single object parameter of multiple styles.

methods.name: setTop
methods.desc: Sets the element's top position directly using CSS style (instead of {@link #setY}).

methods.name: setVisibilityMode
methods.desc:
Sets the element's visibility mode. When setVisible() is called it
will use this to determine whether to set the visibility or the display property.

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc:
Sets the visibility of the element (see details). If the visibilityMode is set to Element.DISPLAY, it will use
the display property to hide the element, otherwise it uses visibility. The default is to hide and show using the visibility property.

methods.name: setWidth
methods.desc: Set the width of the element

methods.name: setX
methods.desc: Sets the X position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: setXY
methods.desc:
Sets the position of the element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: setY
methods.desc: Sets the Y position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

methods.name: setZIndex
methods.desc:
Sets the z-index of this layer and adjusts any shadow and shim z-indexes. The layer z-index is automatically
incremented by two more than the value passed in so that it always shows above any shadow or shim (the shadow
element, if any, will be assigned z-index + 1, and the shim element, if any, will be assigned the unmodified z-index).

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show this element - Uses display mode to determine whether to use "display" or "visibility". See {@link #setVisible}.

methods.name: swallowEvent
methods.desc: Stops the specified event from bubbling and optionally prevents the default action

methods.name: toggle
methods.desc: Toggles the element's visibility or display, depending on visibility mode.

methods.name: toggleClass
methods.desc: Toggles the specified CSS class on this element (removes it if it already exists, otherwise adds it).

methods.name: translatePoints
methods.desc: Translates the passed page coordinates into left/top css values for this element

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes an event handler from this element (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: unclip
methods.desc: Return clipping (overflow) to original clipping before clip() was called

methods.name: unmask
methods.desc:
Removes a previously applied mask. If removeEl is true the mask overlay is destroyed, otherwise
it is cached for reuse.

methods.name: unselectable
methods.desc: Disables text selection for this element (normalized across browsers)

methods.name: up
methods.desc:
Walks up the dom looking for a parent node that matches the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child).
This is a shortcut for findParentNode() that always returns an Roo.Element.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Update the innerHTML of this element, optionally searching for and processing scripts

methods.name: wrap
methods.desc: Creates and wraps this element with another element

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc: True to auto create from scratch, or using a DomHelper Object (defaults to false)

props.name: title
props.desc: Default text to display in the title bar (defaults to null)

props.name: width
props.desc: Width of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: height
props.desc: Height of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: x
props.desc: The default left page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: y
props.desc: The default top page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: animateTarget
props.desc:
Id or element from which the dialog should animate while opening
(defaults to null with no animation)

props.name: resizable
props.desc: False to disable manual dialog resizing (defaults to true)

props.name: resizeHandles
props.desc:
Which resize handles to display - see the {@link Roo.Resizable} handles config
property for valid values (defaults to 'all')

props.name: minHeight
props.desc: The minimum allowable height for a resizable dialog (defaults to 80)

props.name: minWidth
props.desc: The minimum allowable width for a resizable dialog (defaults to 200)

props.name: modal
props.desc: True to show the dialog modally, preventing user interaction with the rest of the page (defaults to false)

props.name: autoScroll
props.desc: True to allow the dialog body contents to overflow and display scrollbars (defaults to false)

props.name: closable
props.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner close button (defaults to true)

props.name: collapsible
props.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner collapse button (defaults to true)

props.name: constraintoviewport
props.desc: True to keep the dialog constrained within the visible viewport boundaries (defaults to true)

props.name: syncHeightBeforeShow
props.desc: True to cause the dimensions to be recalculated before the dialog is shown (defaults to false)

props.name: draggable
props.desc: False to disable dragging of the dialog within the viewport (defaults to true)

props.name: autoTabs
props.desc: If true, all elements with class 'x-dlg-tab' will get automatically converted to tabs (defaults to false)

props.name: tabTag
props.desc: The tag name of tab elements, used when autoTabs = true (defaults to 'div')

props.name: proxyDrag
props.desc:
True to drag a lightweight proxy element rather than the dialog itself, used when
draggable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: fixedcenter
props.desc: True to ensure that anytime the dialog is shown or resized it gets centered (defaults to false)

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right
shadow (defaults to false)

props.name: shadowOffset
props.desc: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 5)

props.name: buttonAlign
props.desc: Valid values are "left," "center" and "right" (defaults to "right")

props.name: minButtonWidth
props.desc: Minimum width of all dialog buttons (defaults to 75)

props.name: buttons
props.desc: Array of buttons

props.name: shim
props.desc: True to create an iframe shim that prevents selects from showing through (defaults to false)

props.name: listeners

events.name: beforehide
events.desc: Fires before this dialog is hidden.

events.name: beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before this dialog is shown.

events.name: hide
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is hidden.

events.name: keydown
events.desc: Fires when a key is pressed

events.name: move
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is moved by the user.

events.name: resize
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is resized by the user.

events.name: show
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is shown.

methods.name: addButton
methods.desc: Adds a button to the footer section of the dialog.

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addKeyListener
methods.desc:
Adds a key listener for when this dialog is displayed.  This allows you to hook in a function that will be
executed in response to a particular key being pressed while the dialog is active.

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: addxtype
methods.desc: Add an xtype element (actually adds to the layout.)

methods.name: alignTo
methods.desc: Aligns the dialog to the specified element

methods.name: anchorTo
methods.sig: (String/HTMLElement/Roo.Element element, String position, Array offsets, Boolean/Number monitorScroll)
methods.desc: Anchors an element to another element and realigns it when the window is resized.

methods.name: beginUpdate
methods.desc: Begins an update of the layout <strike>and sets display to block and visibility to hidden</strike>. Use standard beginUpdate/endUpdate on the layout.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: center
methods.desc: Centers this dialog in the viewport

methods.name: collapse
methods.desc:
Collapses the dialog to its minimized state (only the title bar is visible).
Equivalent to the user clicking the collapse dialog button.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this dialog and all its supporting elements (including any tabs, shim,
shadow, proxy, mask, etc.)  Also removes all event listeners.

methods.name: endUpdate
methods.desc: Ends update of the layout <strike>and resets display to none</strike>. Use standard beginUpdate/endUpdate on the layout.

methods.name: expand
methods.desc:
Expands a collapsed dialog back to its normal state.  Equivalent to the user
clicking the expand dialog button.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.name: focus
methods.desc:
Focuses the dialog.  If a defaultButton is set, it will receive focus, otherwise the
dialog itself will receive focus.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the element for this dialog

methods.name: getLayout
methods.desc: Get the BorderLayout for this dialog

methods.name: getTabs
methods.desc:
Returns the TabPanel component (creates it if it doesn't exist).
Note: If you wish to simply check for the existence of tabs without creating them,
check for a null 'tabs' property.

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hides the dialog.

methods.name: initTabs
methods.desc: Reinitializes the tabs component, clearing out old tabs and finding new ones.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if the dialog is visible

methods.name: moveTo
methods.desc: Moves the dialog's top-left corner to the specified point

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: resizeTo
methods.desc: Resizes the dialog.

methods.name: restoreState
methods.desc: Restores the previous state of the dialog if Roo.state is configured.

methods.name: setContentSize
methods.desc: Resizes the dialog to fit the specified content size.

methods.name: setDefaultButton
methods.desc: Sets the default button to be focused when the dialog is displayed.

methods.name: setTitle
methods.desc: Sets the dialog title text

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Shows the dialog.

methods.name: toBack
methods.desc: Sends this dialog to the back (under) of any other visible dialogs

methods.name: toFront
methods.desc: Brings this dialog to the front of any other visible dialogs

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

props.name: listeners

events.name: layout
events.desc: Fires when a layout is performed.

events.name: regioncollapsed
events.desc: Fires when a region is collapsed.

events.name: regionexpanded

props.name: resizeChild
props.desc: True to resize the first child, or id/element to resize (defaults to false)

props.name: adjustments
props.desc: String "auto" or an array [width, height] with values to be added to the resize operation's new size (defaults to [0, 0])

props.name: minWidth
props.desc: The minimum width for the element (defaults to 5)

props.name: minHeight
props.desc: The minimum height for the element (defaults to 5)

props.name: maxWidth
props.desc: The maximum width for the element (defaults to 10000)

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height for the element (defaults to 10000)

props.name: enabled
props.desc: False to disable resizing (defaults to true)

props.name: wrap
props.desc: True to wrap an element with a div if needed (required for textareas and images, defaults to false)

props.name: width
props.desc: The width of the element in pixels (defaults to null)

props.name: height
props.desc: The height of the element in pixels (defaults to null)

props.name: animate
props.desc: True to animate the resize (not compatible with dynamic sizing, defaults to false)

props.name: duration
props.desc: Animation duration if animate = true (defaults to .35)

props.name: dynamic
props.desc: True to resize the element while dragging instead of using a proxy (defaults to false)

props.name: handles
props.desc: String consisting of the resize handles to display (defaults to undefined)

props.name: multiDirectional
props.desc: Deprecated. The old style of adding multi-direction resize handles, deprecated in favor of the handles config option (defaults to false)

props.name: disableTrackOver
props.desc: True to disable mouse tracking. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

props.name: easing
props.desc: Animation easing if animate = true (defaults to 'easingOutStrong')

props.name: widthIncrement
props.desc: The increment to snap the width resize in pixels (dynamic must be true, defaults to 0)

props.name: heightIncrement
props.desc: The increment to snap the height resize in pixels (dynamic must be true, defaults to 0)

props.name: pinned
props.desc:
True to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, false to display them only when the
user mouses over the resizable borders. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

props.name: preserveRatio
props.desc: True to preserve the original ratio between height and width during resize (defaults to false)

props.name: transparent
props.desc: True for transparent handles. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

props.name: minX
props.desc: The minimum allowed page X for the element (only used for west resizing, defaults to 0)

props.name: minY
props.desc: The minimum allowed page Y for the element (only used for north resizing, defaults to 0)

props.name: draggable
props.desc: Convenience to initialize drag drop (defaults to false)

props.name: constrainTo
props.desc: Constrain the resize to a particular element

props.name: resizeRegion
props.desc: Constrain the resize to a particular region

events.desc: Fired before resize is allowed. Set enabled to false to cancel resize.

events.name: resize
events.desc: Fired after a resize.

events.desc: Fired a resizing.

CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:"x-btn-text-icon")

props.desc: A function called when the button is clicked (can be used instead of click event)

props.desc: The scope of the handler

props.name: pressed
props.desc: True to start pressed (only if enableToggle = true)

props.desc:
The group this toggle button is a member of (only 1 per group can be pressed, only
   applies if enableToggle = true)

props.name: renderTo
props.desc: The element to append the button to

props.name: repeat
props.desc:
True to repeat fire the click event while the mouse is down. This can also be
  an {@link Roo.util.ClickRepeater} config object (defaults to false).

props.desc: The DOM tabIndex for this button (defaults to undefined)

props.desc: True to enable pressed/not pressed toggling (defaults to false)

props.name: menuAlign
props.desc: The position to align the menu to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to 'tl-bl?').

props.desc: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button (defaults to undefined).

props.name: type
props.desc: The button's type, corresponding to the DOM input element type attribute.  Either "submit," "reset" or "button" (default).

props.name: clickEvent
props.desc: The type of event to map to the button's event handler (defaults to 'click')

props.name: handleMouseEvents
props.desc: False to disable visual cues on mouseover, mouseout and mousedown (defaults to true)

props.name: tooltipType
props.desc: The type of tooltip to use. Either "qtip" (default) for QuickTips or "title" for title attribute.

props.name: template
props.desc:
(Optional)
An {@link Roo.Template} with which to create the Button's main element. This Template must
contain numeric substitution parameter 0 if it is to display the tRoo property. Changing the template could
require code modifications if required elements (e.g. a button) aren't present.

methods.name: register
methods.desc:
Register components to be built later.

This solves the following issues
- Building is not done on page load, but after an authentication process has occured.
- Interface elements are registered on page load
- Parent Interface elements may not be loaded before child, so this handles that..


example:

MyApp.register({
          order : '000001',
          module : 'Pman.Tab.projectMgr',
          region : 'center',
          parent : 'Pman.layout',
          disabled : false,  // or use a function..
        })
* @param {Object} details about module

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: append
props.desc: default false

props.name: autoFocus
props.desc: auto focus the first item, default true

props.name: tickable
props.desc: ComboBox with tickable selections (true|false), default false

props.name: triggerList
props.desc: trigger show the list or not (true|false) default true

props.name: showToggleBtn
props.desc: show toggle button or not (true|false) default true

props.name: btnPosition
props.desc: set the position of the trigger button (left | right) default right

props.name: animate
props.desc: default true

props.name: emptyResultText
props.desc: only for touch device

props.name: lazyRender
props.desc:
True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when
rendering into an Roo.Editor, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to:
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "24", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: store
props.desc: The data store to which this combo is bound (defaults to undefined)

props.name: title
props.desc:
If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of
the dropdown list (defaults to undefined, with no header element)

props.name: tpl
props.desc: The template to use to render the output

props.name: listWidth
props.desc: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field)

props.name: displayField
props.desc:
The underlying data field name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'text' if mode = 'local')

props.name: valueField
props.desc:
The underlying data value name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'value' if mode = 'local'). 
Note: use of a valueField requires the user make a selection
in order for a value to be mapped.

props.name: hiddenName
props.desc:
If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the
field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name)

props.name: listClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '')

props.name: selectedClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the selected item in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected')

props.name: shadow
props.desc: True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right

props.name: listAlign
props.desc:
A valid anchor position value. See {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for details on supported
anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl')

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300)

props.name: triggerAction
props.desc:
The action to execute when the trigger field is activated.  Use 'all' to run the
query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'query')

props.name: minChars
props.desc:
The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate
(defaults to 4, does not apply if editable = false)

props.name: typeAhead
props.desc:
True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable
delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false)

props.name: queryDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.name: pageSize
props.desc:
If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the
filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters.  Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0)

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc:
True to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus.  Only applies
when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

props.name: alwaysQuery
props.desc: Disable caching of results, and always send query

props.name: multiple
props.desc: ComboBobArray, default false

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field valid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: specialFilter
props.desc: special filter default false

props.name: mobileTouchView

props.name: validationEvent

The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: hasFeedback

props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).

current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearInvalid
methods.desc: Clear any invalid styles/messages for this field

methods.name: clearValue
methods.desc: Clears any text/value currently set in the field

methods.name: collapse
methods.desc: Hides the dropdown list if it is currently expanded. Fires the 'collapse' event on completion.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM,
removing the component from its {@link Roo.Container} (if applicable) and unregistering it from {@link Roo.ComponentMgr}.

methods.name: disable
methods.desc: Disable this component.

methods.name: doQuery
methods.desc:
Execute a query to filter the dropdown list.  Fires the beforequery event prior to performing the
query allowing the query action to be canceled if needed.

methods.name: enable
methods.desc: Enable this component.

methods.name: expand
methods.desc: Expands the dropdown list if it is currently hidden. Fires the 'expand' event on completion.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Try to focus this component.

methods.name: getChildContainer
methods.desc: Fetch the element to add children to

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the underlying {@link Roo.Element}.

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns the id of this component.

methods.name: getName
methods.desc: Returns the name of the field

methods.name: getRawValue
methods.desc: Returns the raw data value which may or may not be a valid, defined value.  To return a normalized value see {@link #getValue}.

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Returns the currently selected field value or empty string if no value is set.

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide a component - adds 'hidden' class

methods.name: initEvents
methods.desc: Initialize Events for the element

methods.name: inputEl
methods.desc: return the real input element.

methods.name: isExpanded
methods.desc: Returns true if the dropdown list is expanded, else false.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if this component is visible.

methods.name: markInvalid
methods.desc: Mark this field as invalid

methods.name: markValid
methods.desc: Mark this field as valid

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: onTriggerClick
methods.desc:
The function that should handle the trigger's click event.  This method does nothing by default until overridden
by an implementing function.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: render
methods.desc: If this is a lazy rendering component, render it to its container element.

methods.name: reset
methods.desc: Resets the current field value to the originally loaded value and clears any validation messages

methods.name: select
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its numeric index in the list. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: selectByValue
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its data value. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.desc:
Allow or prevent the user from directly editing the field text.  If false is passed,
the user will only be able to select from the items defined in the dropdown list.  This method
is the runtime equivalent of setting the 'editable' config option at config time.

methods.name: setFromData
methods.desc: Sets the value of the field based on a object which is related to the record format for the store.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc:
Sets the specified value into the field.  If the value finds a match, the corresponding record text
will be displayed in the field.  If the value does not match the data value of an existing item,
and the valueNotFoundText config option is defined, it will be displayed as the default field text.
Otherwise the field will be blank (although the value will still be set).

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc: Convenience function to hide or show this component by boolean.

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show a component - removes 'hidden' class

methods.name: tooltipEl
methods.desc: Fetch the element to display the tooltip on.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: validate
methods.desc: Validates the field value

methods.name: validateValue
methods.desc:
Validates a value according to the field's validation rules and marks the field as invalid
if the validation fails

props.name: append
props.desc: default false

props.name: autoFocus
props.desc: auto focus the first item, default true

props.name: tickable
props.desc: ComboBox with tickable selections (true|false), default false

props.name: btnPosition
props.desc: set the position of the trigger button (left | right) default right

props.name: lazyRender
props.desc:
True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when
rendering into an Roo.Editor, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to:
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "24", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: store
props.desc: The data store to which this combo is bound (defaults to undefined)

props.name: title
props.desc:
If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of
the dropdown list (defaults to undefined, with no header element)

props.name: tpl
props.desc: The template to use to render the output

props.name: listWidth
props.desc: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field)

props.name: displayField
props.desc:
The underlying data field name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'text' if mode = 'local')

props.name: valueField
props.desc:
The underlying data value name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'value' if mode = 'local'). 
Note: use of a valueField requires the user make a selection
in order for a value to be mapped.

props.name: hiddenName
props.desc:
If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the
field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name)

props.name: listClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '')

props.name: selectedClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the selected item in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected')

props.name: shadow
props.desc: True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right

props.name: listAlign
props.desc:
A valid anchor position value. See {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for details on supported
anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl')

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300)

props.name: triggerAction
props.desc:
The action to execute when the trigger field is activated.  Use 'all' to run the
query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'query')

props.name: minChars
props.desc:
The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate
(defaults to 4, does not apply if editable = false)

props.name: typeAhead
props.desc:
True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable
delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false)

props.name: queryDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.name: pageSize
props.desc:
If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the
filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters.  Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0)

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc:
True to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus.  Only applies
when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

props.name: alwaysQuery
props.desc: Disable caching of results, and always send query

props.name: multiple
props.desc: ComboBobArray, default false

Select an item in the dropdown list by its numeric index in the list. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: selectByValue
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its data value. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.desc:
Allow or prevent the user from directly editing the field text.  If false is passed,
the user will only be able to select from the items defined in the dropdown list.  This method
is the runtime equivalent of setting the 'editable' config option at config time.

methods.name: setFromData
methods.desc: Sets the value of the field based on a object which is related to the record format for the store.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc:
Sets the specified value into the field.  If the value finds a match, the corresponding record text
will be displayed in the field.  If the value does not match the data value of an existing item,
and the valueNotFoundText config option is defined, it will be displayed as the default field text.
Otherwise the field will be blank (although the value will still be set).
