Validates a value according to the field's validation rules and marks the field as invalid
if the validation fails

props.name: append
props.desc: default false

props.name: autoFocus
props.desc: auto focus the first item, default true

props.name: lazyRender
props.desc:
True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when
rendering into an Roo.Editor, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to:
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "24", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: store
props.desc: The data store to which this combo is bound (defaults to undefined)

props.name: title
props.desc:
If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of
the dropdown list (defaults to undefined, with no header element)

props.name: tpl
props.desc: The template to use to render the output

props.name: listWidth
props.desc: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field)

props.name: displayField
props.desc:
The underlying data field name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'text' if mode = 'local')

props.name: valueField
props.desc:
The underlying data value name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'value' if mode = 'local'). 
Note: use of a valueField requires the user make a selection
in order for a value to be mapped.

props.name: hiddenName
props.desc:
If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the
field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name)

props.name: listClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '')

props.name: selectedClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the selected item in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected')

props.name: shadow
props.desc: True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right

props.name: listAlign
props.desc:
A valid anchor position value. See {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for details on supported
anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl')

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300)

props.name: triggerAction
props.desc:
The action to execute when the trigger field is activated.  Use 'all' to run the
query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'query')

props.name: minChars
props.desc:
The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate
(defaults to 4, does not apply if editable = false)

props.name: typeAhead
props.desc:
True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable
delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false)

props.name: queryDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.name: pageSize
props.desc:
If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the
filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters.  Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0)

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc:
True to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus.  Only applies
when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

props.name: alwaysQuery
props.desc: Disable caching of results, and always send query

props.name: multiple
props.desc: ComboBobArray, default false

props.name: triggerClass
props.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' by default and triggerClass will be appended if specified.

props.name: caret
props.desc: a fontawesome for the trigger icon see http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icons/

props.name: hideTrigger
props.desc: True to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field (defaults to false)

props.name: removable
props.desc: special filter default false

props.name: disabled
props.desc: is it disabled

props.name: fieldLabel
props.desc: - the label associated

props.name: inputType
props.desc: button | checkbox | email | file | hidden | image | number | password | radio | range | reset | search | submit | text

props.name: name
props.desc: name of the input

props.name: placeholder
props.desc: - placeholder to put in text.

props.name: before
props.desc: - input group add on before

props.name: after
props.desc: - input group add on after

props.name: size
props.desc: - (lg|sm) or leave empty..

props.name: xs
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for mobile-sized screens

props.name: sm
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for tablet-sized screens

props.name: md
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for computer-sized screens

props.name: lg
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for large computer-sized screens

props.name: value
props.desc: default value of the input

props.name: labelWidth
props.desc: set the width of label (0-12)

props.name: readOnly
props.desc: Specifies that the field should be read-only

props.name: autocomplete
props.desc: - default is new-password see: https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/input/form/label-and-name-inputs?hl=en

props.name: align
props.desc: Default left

props.name: forceFeedback
props.desc: Default false

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field valid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: hasFeedback
props.desc: default true

props.name: invalidFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: cls
props.desc: css class

props.name: style
props.desc: any extra css

props.name: xattr
props.desc: extra attributes to add to 'element' (used by builder to store stuff.)

props.name: can_build_overlaid
props.desc: True if element can be rebuild from a HTML page

props.name: dataId
props.desc: cutomer id

props.name: tooltip
props.desc: Text for the tooltip

props.name: container_method
props.desc: method to fetch parents container element (used by NavHeaderbar -  getHeaderChildContainer)

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.

events.name: beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.desc: Fires when this field loses input focus.

events.desc: Fires when the dropdown list is collapsed

events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.desc: Fires when the 'edit' icon is pressed (add a listener to enable add button)

events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.desc: Fires when the dropdown list is expanded

events.name: focus
events.desc: Fires when this field receives input focus.

events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: invalid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been marked as invalid.

events.name: keyup
events.desc: Fires after the key up

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when the remove value from the combobox array

events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: select
events.desc: Fires when a list item is selected

events.name: show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

props.desc: default false

props.desc: default empty

props.desc: default false (true | false)

props.name: keyboardNavigation
props.desc: default true

props.name: language
props.desc: default en

props.name: format
props.desc:
The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support.  The format must be
valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'm/d/y').

props.name: altFormats
props.desc:
Multiple date formats separated by "|" to try when parsing a user input value and it doesn't match the defined
format (defaults to 'm/d/Y|m-d-y|m-d-Y|m/d|m-d|d').

props.desc: - the label associated

props.name: placeholder
props.desc: - placeholder to put in text.

props.name: before
props.desc: - input group add on before

props.name: after
props.desc: - input group add on after

props.name: size
props.desc: - (lg|sm) or leave empty..

props.name: xs
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for mobile-sized screens

props.name: sm
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for tablet-sized screens

props.name: md
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for computer-sized screens

props.name: lg
props.desc: colspan out of 12 for large computer-sized screens

props.desc: default value of the input

props.name: labelWidth
props.desc: set the width of label (0-12)

props.name: readOnly
props.desc: Specifies that the field should be read-only

props.name: autocomplete
props.desc: - default is new-password see: https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/input/form/label-and-name-inputs?hl=en

props.name: align
props.desc: Default left

props.name: forceFeedback
props.desc: Default false

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field valid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: hasFeedback
props.desc: default true

props.name: invalidFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: title
props.desc:
The title of the chart
    
 -{Array}  values
 -opts (object) options for the chart 
     o {
     o type (string) type of endings of the bar. Default: 'square'. Other options are: 'round', 'sharp', 'soft'.
     o gutter (number)(string) default '20%' (WHAT DOES IT DO?)
     o vgutter (number)
     o colors (array) colors be used repeatedly to plot the bars. If multicolumn bar is used each sequence of bars with use a different color.
     o stacked (boolean) whether or not to tread values as in a stacked bar chart
     o to
     o stretch (boolean)
     o }
 -opts (object) options for the pie
     o{
     o cut
     o startAngle (number)
     o endAngle (number)
     }

If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.desc: Default left

props.name: forceFeedback
props.desc: Default false

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field valid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: hasFeedback
props.desc: default true

props.name: invalidFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

methods.name: alert
methods.sig: (String title, String msg, Function fn, Object scope)
methods.desc:
Displays a standard read-only message box with an OK button (comparable to the basic JavaScript Window.alert).
If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks the button, and the
id of the button that was clicked will be passed as the only parameter to the callback
(could also be the top-right close button).

methods.name: confirm
methods.sig: (String title, String msg, Function fn, Object scope)
methods.desc:
Displays a confirmation message box with Yes and No buttons (comparable to JavaScript's Window.confirm).
If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks either button, and the id of the
button that was clicked will be passed as the only parameter to the callback (could also be the top-right close button).

methods.name: getDialog
methods.desc: Returns a reference to the underlying {@link Roo.BasicDialog} element

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hides the message box if it is displayed

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if the message box is currently displayed

methods.name: progress
prompt
methods.sig: (String title, String msg, Function fn, Object scope, Boolean/Number multiline)
methods.desc:
Displays a message box with OK and Cancel buttons prompting the user to enter some text (comparable to
JavaScript's Window.prompt).  The prompt can be a single-line or multi-line textbox.  If a callback function
is passed it will be called after the user clicks either button, and the id of the button that was clicked
(could also be the top-right close button) and the text that was entered will be passed as the two
parameters to the callback.

methods.name: show
methods.desc:
Displays a new message box, or reinitializes an existing message box, based on the config options passed in. All functions (e.g. prompt, alert, etc) on MessageBox call this function internally. The following config object properties are supported: 
Property    Type             Description
----------  ---------------  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
animEl            String/Element   An id or Element from which the message box should animate as it opens and
                                   closes (defaults to undefined)
buttons           Object/Boolean   A button config object (e.g., Roo.MessageBox.OKCANCEL or {ok:'Foo',
                                   cancel:'Bar'}), or false to not show any buttons (defaults to false)
closable          Boolean          False to hide the top-right close button (defaults to true).  Note that
                                   progress and wait dialogs will ignore this property and always hide the
                                   close button as they can only be closed programmatically.
cls               String           A custom CSS class to apply to the message box element
defaultTextHeight Number           The default height in pixels of the message box's multiline textarea if
                                   displayed (defaults to 75)
fn                Function         A callback function to execute after closing the dialog.  The arguments to the
                                   function will be btn (the name of the button that was clicked, if applicable,
                                   e.g. "ok"), and text (the value of the active text field, if applicable).
                                   Progress and wait dialogs will ignore this option since they do not respond to
                                   user actions and can only be closed programmatically, so any required function
                                   should be called by the same code after it closes the dialog.
icon              String           A CSS class that provides a background image to be used as an icon for
                                   the dialog (e.g., Roo.MessageBox.WARNING or 'custom-class', defaults to '')
maxWidth          Number           The maximum width in pixels of the message box (defaults to 600)
minWidth          Number           The minimum width in pixels of the message box (defaults to 100)
modal             Boolean          False to allow user interaction with the page while the message box is
                                   displayed (defaults to true)
msg               String           A string that will replace the existing message box body text (defaults
                                   to the XHTML-compliant non-breaking space character ' ')
multiline         Boolean          True to prompt the user to enter multi-line text (defaults to false)
progress          Boolean          True to display a progress bar (defaults to false)
progressText      String           The text to display inside the progress bar if progress = true (defaults to '')
prompt            Boolean          True to prompt the user to enter single-line text (defaults to false)
proxyDrag         Boolean          True to display a lightweight proxy while dragging (defaults to false)
title             String           The title text
value             String           The string value to set into the active textbox element if displayed
wait              Boolean          True to display a progress bar (defaults to false)
width             Number           The width of the dialog in pixels
Example usage: 

Roo.Msg.show({
   title: 'Address',
   msg: 'Please enter your address:',
   width: 300,
   buttons: Roo.MessageBox.OKCANCEL,
   multiline: true,
   fn: saveAddress,
   animEl: 'addAddressBtn'
});

methods.name: updateProgress
methods.desc:
Updates a progress-style message box's text and progress bar.  Only relevant on message boxes
initiated via {@link Roo.MessageBox#progress} or by calling {@link Roo.MessageBox#show} with progress: true.

methods.name: updateText
methods.desc: Updates the message box body text

methods.name: wait
methods.desc:
Displays a message box with an infinitely auto-updating progress bar.  This can be used to block user
interaction while waiting for a long-running process to complete that does not have defined intervals.
You are responsible for closing the message box when the process is complete.

props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field valid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: hasFeedback
props.desc: default true

props.name: invalidFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: validFeedbackIcon
props.desc: The CSS class to use when create feedback icon (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.desc: css class

props.name: style
props.desc: any extra css

props.name: xattr
props.desc: extra attributes to add to 'element' (used by builder to store stuff.)

props.name: can_build_overlaid
props.desc: True if element can be rebuild from a HTML page

props.name: dataId
props.desc: cutomer id

props.name: tooltip
props.desc: Text for the tooltip

props.name: container_method
props.desc: method to fetch parents container element (used by NavHeaderbar -  getHeaderChildContainer)

props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.desc: Specifies the space between cells

props.name: frame
props.desc: Specifies which parts of the outside borders that should be visible

props.name: rules
props.desc: Specifies which parts of the inside borders that should be visible

props.name: sortable

props.name: summary

props.name: width
props.desc: Specifies the width of a table

props.desc: Should the rows be alternative striped

props.desc: Format condensed

props.name: autoAbort

props.name: url
props.desc: (Optional) The default URL to be used for requests to the server. (defaults to undefined)

props.name: extraParams
props.desc:
(Optional) An object containing properties which are used as
extra parameters to each request made by this object. (defaults to undefined)

props.name: defaultHeaders
props.desc:
(Optional) An object containing request headers which are added
 to each request made by this object. (defaults to undefined)

props.name: method
props.desc: (Optional) The default HTTP method to be used for requests. (defaults to undefined; if not set but parms are present will use POST, otherwise GET)

props.name: timeout
props.desc: (Optional) The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests. (defaults to 30000)

props.name: autoAbort
props.desc: (Optional) Whether this request should abort any pending requests. (defaults to false)

props.name: disableCaching
props.desc: (Optional) True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests. (defaults to true)

events.name: beforeload
events.desc: Fires before a network request is made to retrieve a data object.

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires before the load method's callback is called.

events.name: loadexception
events.desc: Fires if an Exception occurs during data retrieval.

methods.name: getConnection
methods.desc: Return the {@link Roo.data.Connection} object being used by this Proxy.

methods.name: load
methods.sig: (Object params, Roo.data.DataReader reader, Function callback, Object scope, Object arg)
methods.desc:
Load data from the configured {@link Roo.data.Connection}, read the data object into
a block of Roo.data.Records using the passed {@link Roo.data.DataReader} implementation, and
process that block using the passed callback.

props.name: totalProperty
props.desc:
Name of the property from which to retrieve the total number of records
in the dataset. This is only needed if the whole dataset is not passed in one go, but is being
paged from the remote server.

props.name: successProperty
props.desc: Name of the property from which to retrieve the success attribute used by forms.

props.name: root
props.desc: name of the property which contains the Array of row objects.

props.name: id
props.desc: Name of the property within a row object that contains a record identifier value.

props.name: fields
props.desc: Array of field definition objects

methods.name: newRow
methods.desc: Create an empty record

methods.name: read
methods.desc: This method is only used by a DataProxy which has retrieved data from a remote server.

methods.name: readRecords
methods.desc: Create a data block containing Roo.data.Records from an XML document.

props.name: fields
props.desc: An array of field definition objects, or field name strings.

props.name: isLocal
props.desc:
flag if data is locally available (and can be always looked up
without a remote query - used by combo/forms at present.

props.name: proxy
props.desc: The Proxy object which provides access to a data object.

props.name: data
props.desc: Inline data to be loaded when the store is initialized.

props.name: reader
props.desc: The Reader object which processes the data object and returns an Array of Roo.data.record objects which are cached keyed by their id property.

props.name: baseParams
props.desc:
An object containing properties which are to be sent as parameters
on any HTTP request

props.name: sortInfo
props.desc: A config object in the format: {field: "fieldName", direction: "ASC|DESC"}

props.name: multiSort
props.desc: enable multi column sorting (sort is based on the order of columns, remote only at present)

props.name: remoteSort
props.desc:
True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed
version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false).

props.name: pruneModifiedRecords
props.desc:
True to clear all modified record information each time the store is
loaded or when a record is removed. (defaults to false).

props.name: listeners

events.name: add
events.desc: Fires when Records have been added to the Store

events.name: beforeload
events.desc:
Fires before a request is made for a new data object.  If the beforeload handler returns false
the load action will be canceled.

events.name: beforeloadadd
events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded.

events.name: clear
events.desc: Fires when the data cache has been cleared.

events.name: datachanged
events.desc:
Fires when the data cache has changed, and a widget which is using this Store
as a Record cache should refresh its view.

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded, before they are added to the store.

events.name: loadexception
events.desc:
Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during loading.
Called with the signature of the Proxy's "loadexception" event.
If you return Json { data: [] , success: false, .... } then this will be thrown with the following args

events.name: metachange
events.desc: Fires when this store's reader provides new metadata (fields). This is currently only support for JsonReaders.

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when a Record has been removed from the Store

events.name: update
events.desc: Fires when a Record has been updated

methods.name: add
methods.desc: Add Records to the Store and fires the add event.

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearFilter
methods.desc: Revert to a view of the Record cache with no filtering applied.

methods.name: collect
methods.desc: Collects unique values for a particular dataIndex from this store.

methods.name: commitChanges
methods.desc:
Commit all Records with outstanding changes. To handle updates for changes, subscribe to the
Store's "update" event, and perform updating when the third parameter is Roo.data.Record.COMMIT.

methods.name: each
methods.desc: Calls the specified function for each of the Records in the cache.

methods.name: filter
methods.desc: Filter the records by a specified property.

methods.name: filterBy
methods.desc:
Filter by a function. The specified function will be called with each
record in this data source. If the function returns true the record is included,
otherwise it is filtered.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.name: getAt
methods.desc: Get the Record at the specified index.

methods.name: getById
methods.desc: Get the Record with the specified id.

methods.name: getCount
methods.desc:
Gets the number of cached records.

If using paging, this may not be the total size of the dataset. If the data object used by the Reader contains the dataset size, then the getTotalCount() function returns the data set size

methods.name: getModifiedRecords
methods.desc:
Gets all records modified since the last commit.  Modified records are persisted across load operations
(e.g., during paging).

methods.name: getRange
methods.desc: Returns a range of Records between specified indices.

methods.name: getSortState
methods.desc:
Returns the sort state of the Store as an object with two properties: 

 field {String} The name of the field by which the Records are sorted
 direction {String} The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC"

methods.name: getTotalCount
methods.desc:
Gets the total number of records in the dataset as returned by the server.

If using paging, for this to be accurate, the data object used by the Reader must contain the dataset size

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: indexOf
methods.desc: Get the index within the cache of the passed Record.

methods.name: indexOfId
methods.desc: Get the index within the cache of the Record with the passed id.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts Records to the Store at the given index and fires the add event.

methods.name: load
methods.desc:
Loads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader.

If using remote paging, then the first load call must specify the start and limit properties in the options.params property to establish the initial position within the dataset, and the number of Records to cache on each read from the Proxy.

It is important to note that for remote data sources, loading is asynchronous, and this call will return before the new data has been loaded. Perform any post-processing in a callback function, or in a "load" event handler.

methods.name: loadData
methods.desc:
Loads data from a passed data block. A Reader which understands the format of the data
must have been configured in the constructor.

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: query
methods.desc: Query the records by a specified property.

methods.name: queryBy
methods.desc:
Query by a function. The specified function will be called with each
record in this data source. If the function returns true the record is included
in the results.

methods.name: rejectChanges
methods.desc: Cancel outstanding changes on all changed records.

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: reload
methods.desc:
Reloads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader and
the options from the last load operation performed.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Remove a Record from the Store and fires the remove event.

methods.name: removeAll
methods.desc: Remove all Records from the Store and fires the clear event.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: setDefaultSort
methods.desc: Sets the default sort column and order to be used by the next load operation.

methods.name: sort
methods.desc:
Sort the Records.
If remote sorting is used, the sort is performed on the server, and the cache is
reloaded. If local sorting is used, the cache is sorted internally.

methods.name: sum
methods.desc: Sums the value of property for each record between start and end and returns the result.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: load
methods.sig: (Object params, Roo.data.DataReader reader, Function callback, Object scope, Object arg)
methods.desc:
Load data from the requested source (in this case an in-memory
data object passed to the constructor), read the data object into
a block of Roo.data.Records using the passed Roo.data.DataReader implementation, and
process that block using the passed callback.

props.name: leaf
props.desc: true if this node is a leaf and does not have children

props.name: id
props.desc: The id for this node. If one is not specified, one is generated.

props.name: listeners

events.name: append
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is appended

events.name: beforeappend
events.desc: Fires before a new child is appended, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforeinsert
events.desc: Fires before a new child is inserted, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforemove
events.desc: Fires before this node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforeremove
events.desc: Fires before a child is removed, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: insert
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is inserted.

events.name: move
events.desc: Fires when this node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when a child node is removed

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: appendChild
methods.desc: Insert node(s) as the last child node of this node.

methods.name: bubble
methods.desc: Bubbles up the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: cascade
methods.desc: Cascades down the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

methods.name: contains
methods.desc: Returns true if this node is an ancestor (at any point) of the passed node.

methods.name: eachChild
methods.desc: Interates the child nodes of this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the iteration stops.

methods.name: findChild
methods.desc: Finds the first child that has the attribute with the specified value.

methods.name: findChildBy
methods.desc:
Finds the first child by a custom function. The child matches if the function passed
returns true.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.name: getDepth
methods.desc: Returns depth of this node (the root node has a depth of 0)

methods.name: getOwnerTree
methods.desc: Returns the tree this node is in.

methods.name: getPath
methods.desc: Returns the path for this node. The path can be used to expand or select this node programmatically.

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: indexOf
methods.desc: Returns the index of a child node

methods.name: insertBefore
methods.desc: Inserts the first node before the second node in this nodes childNodes collection.

methods.name: isAncestor
methods.desc: Returns true if the passed node is an ancestor (at any point) of this node.

methods.name: isFirst
methods.desc: Returns true if this node is the first child of its parent

methods.name: isLast
methods.desc: Returns true if this node is the last child of its parent

methods.name: isLeaf
methods.desc: Returns true if this node is a leaf

methods.name: item
methods.desc: Returns the child node at the specified index.

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeChild
methods.desc: Removes a child node from this node.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: replaceChild
methods.desc: Replaces one child node in this node with another.

methods.name: sort
methods.desc: Sorts this nodes children using the supplied sort function

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: commit
methods.desc:
Usually called by the {@link Roo.data.Store} which owns the Record. Commits all changes made to the Record since either creation, or the last commit operation.

Developers should subscribe to the {@link Roo.data.Store#update} event to have their code notified of commit operations.

methods.name: copy
methods.desc: Creates a copy of this record.

methods.name: create
methods.desc: Generate a constructor for a specific record layout.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Get the value of the named field.

methods.name: reject
methods.desc:
Usually called by the {@link Roo.data.Store} which owns the Record. Rejects all changes made to the Record since either creation, or the last commit operation. Modified fields are reverted to their original values.

Developers should subscribe to the {@link Roo.data.Store#update} event to have their code notified of reject operations.

methods.name: set
methods.desc: Set the named field to the specified value.

props.name: url
props.desc: The URL from which to request the data object.

props.name: timeout
props.desc: (Optional) The number of milliseconds to wait for a response. Defaults to 30 seconds.

props.name: callbackParam
props.desc:
(Optional) The name of the parameter to pass to the server which tells the server the name of the callback function set up by the load call to process the returned data object. Defaults to "callback".

The server-side processing must read this parameter value, and generate javascript output which calls this named function passing the data object as its only parameter.

props.name: nocache
props.desc:
(Optional) Defaults to true. Disable cacheing by adding a unique parameter
name to the request.

methods.name: abort
methods.desc: Abort the current server request.

methods.name: load
methods.sig: (Object params, Roo.data.DataReader reader, Function callback, Object scope, Object arg)
methods.desc:
Load data from the configured URL, read the data object into
a block of Roo.data.Records using the passed Roo.data.DataReader implementation, and
process that block using the passed callback.

props.name: id
props.desc: The array index of the record id. Leave blank to auto generate ids.

props.name: fields
props.desc: An array of field definition objects, or field name strings.

props.name: data
props.desc: The multi-dimensional array of data

props.name: isLocal
props.desc:
flag if data is locally available (and can be always looked up
without a remote query - used by combo/forms at present.

props.name: proxy
props.desc: The Proxy object which provides access to a data object.

props.name: reader
props.desc: The Reader object which processes the data object and returns an Array of Roo.data.record objects which are cached keyed by their id property.

props.name: baseParams
props.desc:
An object containing properties which are to be sent as parameters
on any HTTP request

props.name: sortInfo
props.desc: A config object in the format: {field: "fieldName", direction: "ASC|DESC"}

props.name: multiSort
props.desc: enable multi column sorting (sort is based on the order of columns, remote only at present)

props.name: remoteSort
props.desc:
True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed
version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false).

props.name: pruneModifiedRecords
props.desc:
True to clear all modified record information each time the store is
loaded or when a record is removed. (defaults to false).

props.name: listeners

events.name: add
events.desc: Fires when Records have been added to the Store

events.name: beforeload
events.desc:
Fires before a request is made for a new data object.  If the beforeload handler returns false
the load action will be canceled.

events.name: beforeloadadd
events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded.

events.name: clear
events.desc: Fires when the data cache has been cleared.

events.name: datachanged
events.desc:
Fires when the data cache has changed, and a widget which is using this Store
as a Record cache should refresh its view.

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded, before they are added to the store.

events.name: loadexception
events.desc:
Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during loading.
Called with the signature of the Proxy's "loadexception" event.
If you return Json { data: [] , success: false, .... } then this will be thrown with the following args

events.name: metachange
events.desc: Fires when this store's reader provides new metadata (fields). This is currently only support for JsonReaders.

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when a Record has been removed from the Store

events.name: update
events.desc: Fires when a Record has been updated

methods.name: add
methods.desc: Add Records to the Store and fires the add event.

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearFilter
methods.desc: Revert to a view of the Record cache with no filtering applied.

methods.name: collect
methods.desc: Collects unique values for a particular dataIndex from this store.

methods.name: commitChanges
methods.desc:
Commit all Records with outstanding changes. To handle updates for changes, subscribe to the
Store's "update" event, and perform updating when the third parameter is Roo.data.Record.COMMIT.

methods.name: each
methods.desc: Calls the specified function for each of the Records in the cache.

methods.name: filter
methods.desc: Filter the records by a specified property.

methods.name: filterBy
methods.desc:
Filter by a function. The specified function will be called with each
record in this data source. If the function returns true the record is included,
otherwise it is filtered.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.name: getAt
methods.desc: Get the Record at the specified index.

methods.name: getById
methods.desc: Get the Record with the specified id.

methods.name: getCount
methods.desc:
Gets the number of cached records.

If using paging, this may not be the total size of the dataset. If the data object used by the Reader contains the dataset size, then the getTotalCount() function returns the data set size

methods.name: getModifiedRecords
methods.desc:
Gets all records modified since the last commit.  Modified records are persisted across load operations
(e.g., during paging).

methods.name: getRange
methods.desc: Returns a range of Records between specified indices.

methods.name: getSortState
methods.desc:
Returns the sort state of the Store as an object with two properties: 

 field {String} The name of the field by which the Records are sorted
 direction {String} The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC"

methods.name: getTotalCount
methods.desc:
Gets the total number of records in the dataset as returned by the server.

If using paging, for this to be accurate, the data object used by the Reader must contain the dataset size

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: indexOf
methods.desc: Get the index within the cache of the passed Record.

methods.name: indexOfId
methods.desc: Get the index within the cache of the Record with the passed id.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts Records to the Store at the given index and fires the add event.

methods.name: load
methods.desc:
Loads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader.

If using remote paging, then the first load call must specify the start and limit properties in the options.params property to establish the initial position within the dataset, and the number of Records to cache on each read from the Proxy.

It is important to note that for remote data sources, loading is asynchronous, and this call will return before the new data has been loaded. Perform any post-processing in a callback function, or in a "load" event handler.

methods.name: loadData
methods.desc:
Loads data from a passed data block. A Reader which understands the format of the data
must have been configured in the constructor.

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: query
methods.desc: Query the records by a specified property.

methods.name: queryBy
methods.desc:
Query by a function. The specified function will be called with each
record in this data source. If the function returns true the record is included
in the results.

methods.name: rejectChanges
methods.desc: Cancel outstanding changes on all changed records.

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: reload
methods.desc:
Reloads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader and
the options from the last load operation performed.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Remove a Record from the Store and fires the remove event.

methods.name: removeAll
methods.desc: Remove all Records from the Store and fires the clear event.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: setDefaultSort
methods.desc: Sets the default sort column and order to be used by the next load operation.

methods.name: sort
methods.desc:
Sort the Records.
If remote sorting is used, the sort is performed on the server, and the cache is
reloaded. If local sorting is used, the cache is sorted internally.

methods.name: sum
methods.desc: Sums the value of property for each record between start and end and returns the result.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: asDate
methods.desc: Date sorting

methods.name: asFloat
methods.desc: Float sorting

methods.name: asInt
methods.desc: Integer sorting

methods.name: asText
methods.desc: Strips all HTML tags to sort on text only

methods.name: asUCString
methods.desc: Case insensitive string

methods.name: asUCText
methods.desc: Strips all HTML tags to sort on text only - Case insensitive

methods.name: none
methods.desc: Default sort that does nothing

methods.desc: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleId
methods.desc:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleType
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation
when clicked.  This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a
drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: addToGroup
methods.desc:
Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many
groups as needed.

methods.name: alignElWithMouse
methods.desc:
Sets the element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

methods.name: applyConfig
methods.desc:
Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor.
This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain.  So
a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and
DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in
each object.

methods.name: autoOffset
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset to the distance between the linked element's top
left corner and the location the element was clicked

methods.name: cachePosition
methods.desc:
Saves the most recent position so that we can reset the constraints and
tick marks on-demand.  We need to know this so that we can calculate the
number of pixels the element is offset from its original position.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearConstraints
methods.desc:
Clears any constraints applied to this instance.  Also clears ticks
since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

methods.name: clearTicks
methods.desc: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

methods.name: endDrag
methods.desc: Fired when we are done dragging the object

methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

Returns a reference to the actual element to drag.  By default this is
the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another
element. An example of this can be found in Roo.dd.DDProxy

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns a reference to the linked element

methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

Sets up the DragDrop object.  Must be called in the constructor of any
Roo.dd.DragDrop subclass

methods.name: initTarget
methods.desc:
Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not
get a mousedown handler.

methods.desc:
Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked
(meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

methods.desc:
By default, all insances can be a drop target.  This can be disabled by
setting isTarget to false.

methods.desc: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: resetConstraints
methods.desc: resetConstraints must be called if you manually reposition a dd element.

methods.name: setDelta
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset.  You can call this directly to force the
offset to be in a particular location (e.g., pass in 0,0 to set it
to the center of the object)

methods.name: setDragElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify that an element other than the linked element
will be moved with the cursor during a drag

methods.name: setDragElPos
methods.desc:
Sets the drag element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

methods.name: setHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be
used to initiate the drag operation.  An example of this would be if
you have a content div with text and links.  Clicking anywhere in the
content area would normally start the drag operation.  Use this method
to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element
that starts the drag operation.

methods.name: setInitPosition
methods.desc: Stores the initial placement of the linked element.

methods.name: setOuterHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to set an element outside of the linked element as a drag
handle

methods.name: setPadding
methods.sig: (int iTop, int iRight, int iBot, int iLeft)
methods.desc:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

methods.name: setXConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Use
this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element.  Pass in
0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

methods.name: setYConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Set
this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the
parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

methods.name: startDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked
and the drag or mousedown time thresholds have beeen met.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: unlock
methods.desc: Unlock this instace

methods.name: unreg
methods.desc: Remove all drag and drop hooks for this element

props.name: listeners

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleId
methods.desc:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleType
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation
when clicked.  This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a
drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: addToGroup
methods.desc:
Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many
groups as needed.

methods.name: alignElWithMouse
methods.desc:
Sets the element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

methods.name: applyConfig
methods.desc:
Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor.
This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain.  So
a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and
DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in
each object.

methods.name: autoOffset
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset to the distance between the linked element's top
left corner and the location the element was clicked

methods.name: cachePosition
methods.desc:
Saves the most recent position so that we can reset the constraints and
tick marks on-demand.  We need to know this so that we can calculate the
number of pixels the element is offset from its original position.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearConstraints
methods.desc:
Clears any constraints applied to this instance.  Also clears ticks
since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

methods.name: clearTicks
methods.desc: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

methods.name: createFrame
methods.desc: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

methods.name: endDrag
methods.desc: Fired when we are done dragging the object

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).
toString method

methods.name: getDragEl
methods.desc:
Returns a reference to the actual element to drag.  By default this is
the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another
element. An example of this can be found in Roo.dd.DDProxy

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns a reference to the linked element

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: init
methods.desc:
Sets up the DragDrop object.  Must be called in the constructor of any
Roo.dd.DragDrop subclass

methods.name: initFrame
methods.desc:
Initialization for the drag frame element.  Must be called in the
constructor of all subclasses

methods.name: initTarget
methods.desc:
Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not
get a mousedown handler.

methods.name: isLocked
methods.desc:
Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked
(meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

methods.name: isTarget
methods.desc:
By default, all insances can be a drop target.  This can be disabled by
setting isTarget to false.

methods.name: isValidHandleChild
methods.desc: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

methods.name: lock
methods.desc: Lock this instance
