methods.name: getBestMatch
methods.desc:
Helper function for getting the best match from the list of drag
and drop objects returned by the drag and drop events when we are
in INTERSECT mode.  It returns either the first object that the
cursor is over, or the object that has the greatest overlap with
the dragged element.

methods.name: getCss
methods.desc:
Returns the style property for the DOM element (i.e.,
document.getElById(id).style)

methods.name: getDDById
methods.desc: Returns the DragDrop instance for a given id

methods.name: getElement
methods.desc: Returns the actual DOM element

methods.name: getLocation
methods.desc:
Returns a Region object containing the drag and drop element's position
and size, including the padding configured for it

methods.name: getPosX
methods.desc: Returns the X position of an html element

methods.name: getPosY
methods.desc: Returns the Y position of an html element

methods.name: getRelated
methods.desc:
Returns the drag and drop instances that are in all groups the
passed in instance belongs to.

methods.name: getScrollLeft
methods.desc: Gets the scrollLeft

methods.name: getScrollTop
methods.desc: Gets the scrollTop

methods.name: getStyle
methods.desc: Returns the specified element style property

methods.name: handleWasClicked
methods.desc:
Recursively searches the immediate parent and all child nodes for
the handle element in order to determine wheter or not it was
clicked.

methods.name: isDragDrop
methods.desc:
Utility function to determine if a given element has been
registered as a drag drop item.

methods.name: isHandle
methods.desc:
Utility function to determine if a given element has been
registered as a drag drop handle for the given Drag Drop object.

methods.name: isLegalTarget
methods.desc:
Returns true if the specified dd target is a legal target for
the specifice drag obj

methods.name: isLocked
methods.desc: Is drag and drop locked?

methods.name: isTypeOfDD
methods.desc:
My goal is to be able to transparently determine if an object is
typeof DragDrop, and the exact subclass of DragDrop.  typeof
returns "object", oDD.constructor.toString() always returns
"DragDrop" and not the name of the subclass.  So for now it just
evaluates a well-known variable in DragDrop.

methods.name: lock
methods.desc: Lock all drag and drop functionality

methods.name: moveToEl
methods.desc:
Sets the x/y position of an element to the location of the
target element.

methods.name: numericSort
methods.desc: Numeric array sort function

methods.name: refreshCache
methods.desc: Refreshes the cache of the top-left and bottom-right points of the drag and drop objects in the specified group(s). This is in the format that is stored in the drag and drop instance, so typical usage is: Roo.dd.DragDropMgr.refreshCache(ddinstance.groups); Alternatively: Roo.dd.DragDropMgr.refreshCache({group1:true, group2:true});

methods.name: regDragDrop
methods.desc:
Each DragDrop instance must be registered with the DragDropMgr.
This is executed in DragDrop.init()

methods.name: regHandle
methods.desc:
Each DragDrop handle element must be registered.  This is done
automatically when executing DragDrop.setHandleElId()

methods.name: startDrag
methods.desc:
Fired when either the drag pixel threshol or the mousedown hold
time threshold has been met.

methods.name: stopEvent
methods.desc:
Utility to stop event propagation and event default, if these
features are turned on.

methods.name: swapNode
methods.desc:
Swap two nodes.  In IE, we use the native method, for others we
emulate the IE behavior

methods.name: unlock
methods.desc: Unlock all drag and drop functionality

methods.name: verifyEl
methods.desc:
This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM.  The
main purpose is to handle cases where innerHTML is used to remove
drag and drop objects from the DOM.  IE provides an 'unspecified
error' when trying to access the offsetParent of such an element

props.name: dropAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

props.name: dropNotAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

props.name: listeners

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleId
methods.desc:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleType
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation
when clicked.  This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a
drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: addToGroup
methods.desc:
Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many
groups as needed.

methods.name: alignElWithMouse
methods.desc:
Sets the element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

methods.name: applyConfig
methods.desc:
Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor.
This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain.  So
a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and
DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in
each object.

methods.name: autoOffset
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset to the distance between the linked element's top
left corner and the location the element was clicked

methods.name: beforeDragDrop
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged
item is dropped onto the target and optionally cancel the onDragDrop.

methods.name: beforeDragEnter
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action
before the dragged item enters the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragEnter.

methods.name: beforeDragOut
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged
item is dragged out of the target without dropping, and optionally cancel the onDragOut.

methods.name: beforeDragOver
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action
while the dragged item is over the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragOver.

methods.name: beforeInvalidDrop
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid
drop has occurred.

methods.name: cachePosition
methods.desc:
Saves the most recent position so that we can reset the constraints and
tick marks on-demand.  We need to know this so that we can calculate the
number of pixels the element is offset from its original position.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearConstraints
methods.desc:
Clears any constraints applied to this instance.  Also clears ticks
since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

methods.name: clearTicks
methods.desc: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

methods.name: createFrame
methods.desc: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

methods.name: endDrag
methods.desc: Fired when we are done dragging the object

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).
toString method

methods.name: getDragData
methods.desc: Returns the data object associated with this drag source

methods.name: getDragEl
methods.desc:
Returns a reference to the actual element to drag.  By default this is
the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another
element. An example of this can be found in Roo.dd.DDProxy

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns a reference to the linked element

methods.name: getProxy
methods.desc: Returns the drag source's underlying {@link Roo.dd.StatusProxy}

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: hideProxy
methods.desc: Hides the drag source's {@link Roo.dd.StatusProxy}

methods.name: init
methods.desc:
Sets up the DragDrop object.  Must be called in the constructor of any
Roo.dd.DragDrop subclass

methods.name: initFrame
methods.desc:
Initialization for the drag frame element.  Must be called in the
constructor of all subclasses

methods.name: initTarget
methods.desc:
Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not
get a mousedown handler.

methods.name: isLocked
methods.desc:
Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked
(meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

methods.name: isTarget
methods.desc:
By default, all insances can be a drop target.  This can be disabled by
setting isTarget to false.

methods.name: isValidHandleChild
methods.desc: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

methods.name: lock
methods.desc: Lock this instance

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: onAvailable
methods.desc:
Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial
position was determined.

methods.name: onBeforeDrag
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the initial
drag event begins and optionally cancel it.

methods.name: onDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an
object.

methods.name: onDragDrop
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop
obj

methods.name: onDragEnter
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over
another DragDrop obj

methods.name: onDragOut
methods.desc: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

methods.name: onDragOver
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this element is hovering over another
DragDrop obj

methods.name: onInvalidDrop
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on an area with no
drop target

methods.name: onMouseDown
methods.desc: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mousedown

methods.name: onMouseUp
methods.desc: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

methods.name: onStartDrag
methods.desc:
An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action once the initial
drag event has begun.  The drag cannot be canceled from this function.

methods.name: padding
methods.desc:
The padding configured for this drag and drop object for calculating
the drop zone intersection with this object.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeFromGroup
methods.desc: Remove's this instance from the supplied interaction group

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Unsets an invalid css class

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleId
methods.desc: Unsets an invalid handle id

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleType
methods.desc: Unsets an excluded tag name set by addInvalidHandleType

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: resetConstraints
methods.desc: resetConstraints must be called if you manually reposition a dd element.

methods.name: setDelta
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset.  You can call this directly to force the
offset to be in a particular location (e.g., pass in 0,0 to set it
to the center of the object)

methods.name: setDragElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify that an element other than the linked element
will be moved with the cursor during a drag

methods.name: setDragElPos
methods.desc:
Sets the drag element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

methods.name: setHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be
used to initiate the drag operation.  An example of this would be if
you have a content div with text and links.  Clicking anywhere in the
content area would normally start the drag operation.  Use this method
to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element
that starts the drag operation.

methods.name: setInitPosition
methods.desc: Stores the initial placement of the linked element.

methods.name: setOuterHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to set an element outside of the linked element as a drag
handle

methods.name: setPadding
methods.sig: (int iTop, int iRight, int iBot, int iLeft)
methods.desc:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

methods.name: setXConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Use
this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element.  Pass in
0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

methods.name: setYConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Set
this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the
parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

methods.name: startDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked
and the drag or mousedown time thresholds have beeen met.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: unlock
methods.desc: Unlock this instace

methods.name: unreg
methods.desc: Remove all drag and drop hooks for this element

True to register this container with the Scrollmanager

props.name: overClass
props.desc: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it (defaults to "").

props.name: ddGroup
props.desc: The drag drop group to handle drop events for

props.name: dropAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

props.name: dropNotAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

props.name: success
props.desc: set this after drop listener..

props.name: valid
props.desc:
true/false or string (ok-add/ok-sub/ok/nodrop)
if the drop point is valid for over/enter..

props.name: listeners

events.name: drop
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has
been dropped on it.  This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an
implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's
repair action does not run.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.success

events.name: enter
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the
target.  This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element
and returns the dropAllowed config value.  This method should be overridden if drop validation is required.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.overClass and this.dropAllowed

events.name: out
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged
out of the target without dropping.  This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by
overClass (if any) from the drop element.

events.name: over
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target.
This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target.
This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.dropAllowed

used to initiate the drag operation.  An example of this would be if
you have a content div with text and links.  Clicking anywhere in the
content area would normally start the drag operation.  Use this method
to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element
that starts the drag operation.

methods.name: setInitPosition
methods.desc: Stores the initial placement of the linked element.

methods.name: setOuterHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to set an element outside of the linked element as a drag
handle

methods.name: setPadding
methods.sig: (int iTop, int iRight, int iBot, int iLeft)
methods.desc:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

methods.name: setXConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Use
this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element.  Pass in
0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

methods.name: setYConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Set
this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the
parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

methods.name: startDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked
and the drag or mousedown time thresholds have beeen met.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: unlock
methods.desc: Unlock this instace

methods.name: unreg
methods.desc: Remove all drag and drop hooks for this element

props.name: overClass
props.desc: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it (defaults to "").

props.name: ddGroup
props.desc: The drag drop group to handle drop events for

props.name: dropAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

props.name: dropNotAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

props.name: success
props.desc: set this after drop listener..

props.name: valid
props.desc:
true/false or string (ok-add/ok-sub/ok/nodrop)
if the drop point is valid for over/enter..

props.name: listeners

events.name: drop
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has
been dropped on it.  This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an
implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's
repair action does not run.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.success

events.name: enter
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the
target.  This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element
and returns the dropAllowed config value.  This method should be overridden if drop validation is required.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.overClass and this.dropAllowed

events.name: out
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged
out of the target without dropping.  This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by
overClass (if any) from the drop element.

events.name: over
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target.
This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target.
This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.dropAllowed

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleId
methods.desc:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

methods.name: addInvalidHandleType
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation
when clicked.  This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a
drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: addToGroup
methods.desc:
Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many
groups as needed.

methods.name: applyConfig
methods.desc:
Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor.
This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain.  So
a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and
DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in
each object.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearConstraints
methods.desc:
Clears any constraints applied to this instance.  Also clears ticks
since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

methods.name: clearTicks
methods.desc: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

methods.name: endDrag
methods.desc: Fired when we are done dragging the object

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).
toString method

methods.name: getDragEl
methods.desc:
Returns a reference to the actual element to drag.  By default this is
the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another
element. An example of this can be found in Roo.dd.DDProxy

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns a reference to the linked element

methods.name: getTargetFromEvent
methods.desc:
Returns a custom data object associated with the DOM node that is the target of the event.  By default
this looks up the event target in the {@link Roo.dd.Registry}, although you can override this method to
provide your own custom lookup.

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: init
methods.desc:
Sets up the DragDrop object.  Must be called in the constructor of any
Roo.dd.DragDrop subclass

methods.name: initTarget
methods.desc:
Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not
get a mousedown handler.

methods.name: isLocked
methods.desc:
Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked
(meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

methods.name: isTarget
methods.desc:
By default, all insances can be a drop target.  This can be disabled by
setting isTarget to false.

methods.name: isValidHandleChild
methods.desc: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

methods.name: lock
methods.desc: Lock this instance

methods.name: notifyDrop
methods.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop zone that the dragged item has
been dropped on it.  The drag zone will look up the target node based on the event passed in, and if there
is a node registered for that event, it will delegate to {@link #onNodeDrop} for node-specific handling,
otherwise it will call {@link #onContainerDrop}.

methods.name: notifyEnter
methods.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop zone that the source is now over
the zone.  The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed and expects that only registered drop
nodes can process drag drop operations, so if you need the drop zone itself to be able to process drops
you should override this method and provide a custom implementation.

methods.name: notifyOut
methods.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop zone that the source has been dragged
out of the zone without dropping.  If the drag source is currently over a registered node, the notification
will be delegated to {@link #onNodeOut} for node-specific handling, otherwise it will be ignored.

methods.name: notifyOver
methods.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls continuously while it is being dragged over the drop zone.
This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop zone.
It will call {@link #onNodeOver} while the drag source is over a registered node, and will also automatically
delegate to the appropriate node-specific methods as necessary when the drag source enters and exits
registered nodes ({@link #onNodeEnter}, {@link #onNodeOut}). If the drag source is not currently over a
registered node, it will call {@link #onContainerOver}.

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: onAvailable
methods.desc:
Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial
position was determined.

methods.name: onContainerDrop
methods.desc:
Called internally when the DropZone determines that a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} has been dropped on it,
but not on any of its registered drop nodes.  The default implementation returns false, so it should be
overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event if you need the drop zone itself to
be able to accept drops.  It should return true when valid so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

methods.name: onContainerOver
methods.desc:
Called internally while the DropZone determines that a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} is being dragged over it,
but not over any of its registered drop nodes.  The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so
it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback if necessary.

methods.name: onDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an
object.

methods.name: onDragDrop
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop
obj

methods.name: onDragEnter
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over
another DragDrop obj

methods.name: onDragOut
methods.desc: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

methods.name: onDragOver
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this element is hovering over another
DragDrop obj

methods.name: onInvalidDrop
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on an area with no
drop target

methods.name: onMouseDown
methods.desc: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mousedown

methods.name: onMouseUp
methods.desc: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

methods.name: onNodeDrop
methods.sig: (Object nodeData, Roo.dd.DragSource source, Event e, Object data)
methods.desc:
Called internally when the DropZone determines that a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} has been dropped onto
the drop node.  The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the
appropriate processing of the drop event and return true so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

methods.name: onNodeEnter
methods.sig: (Object nodeData, Roo.dd.DragSource source, Event e, Object data)
methods.desc:
Called internally when the DropZone determines that a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} has entered a drop node
that it has registered.  This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide
node-specific processing if necessary.

methods.name: onNodeOut
methods.sig: (Object nodeData, Roo.dd.DragSource source, Event e, Object data)
methods.desc:
Called internally when the DropZone determines that a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} has been dragged out of
the drop node without dropping.  This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide
node-specific processing if necessary.

methods.name: onNodeOver
methods.sig: (Object nodeData, Roo.dd.DragSource source, Event e, Object data)
methods.desc:
Called internally while the DropZone determines that a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} is over a drop node
that it has registered.  The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be
overridden to provide the proper feedback.

methods.name: padding
methods.desc:
The padding configured for this drag and drop object for calculating
the drop zone intersection with this object.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeFromGroup
methods.desc: Remove's this instance from the supplied interaction group

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Unsets an invalid css class

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleId

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleType
methods.desc: Unsets an excluded tag name set by addInvalidHandleType

that starts the drag operation.

Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands

Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom

methods.name: setXConstraint

By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Use
this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element.  Pass in
0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

methods.name: setYConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Set
this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the
parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked

methods.name: getHandle

methods.name: getTarget

methods.name: getTargetFromEvent
methods.desc: Returns a custom data object that is registered for the DOM node that is the target of the event

methods.name: register
methods.desc: Register a drag drop element

methods.name: unregister
methods.desc: Unregister a drag drop element

methods.name: refreshCache
methods.desc: Manually trigger a cache refresh.

methods.name: register
methods.desc: Registers new overflow element(s) to auto scroll

methods.name: unregister
methods.desc: Unregisters overflow element(s) so they are no longer scrolled

props.name: dropAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class to apply to the status element when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

props.name: dropNotAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class to apply to the status element when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the underlying proxy {@link Roo.Layer}

methods.name: getGhost
methods.desc: Returns the ghost element

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hides the proxy

methods.name: repair
methods.desc:
Causes the proxy to return to its position of origin via an animation.  Should be called after an
invalid drop operation by the item being dragged.

methods.name: reset
methods.desc: Resets the status indicator to the default dropNotAllowed value

methods.name: setStatus
methods.desc:
Updates the proxy's visual element to indicate the status of whether or not drop is allowed
over the current target element.

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Displays this proxy

methods.name: stop
methods.desc: Stops the repair animation if it's currently running

methods.name: sync
methods.desc: Force the Layer to sync its shadow and shim positions to the element

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates the contents of the ghost element

props.name: method
props.desc: The request method to use (GET or POST) for form actions if one isn't supplied in the action options.

props.name: reader
props.desc:
An Roo.data.DataReader (e.g. {@link Roo.data.XmlReader}) to be used to read data when executing "load" actions.
This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

props.name: errorReader
props.desc:
An Roo.data.DataReader (e.g. {@link Roo.data.XmlReader}) to be used to read data when reading validation errors on "submit" actions.
This is completely optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

props.name: url
props.desc: The URL to use for form actions if one isn't supplied in the action options.

props.name: fileUpload
props.desc: Set to true if this form is a file upload.

props.name: baseParams
props.desc: Parameters to pass with all requests. e.g. baseParams: {id: '123', foo: 'bar'}.

props.name: timeout
props.desc: Timeout for form actions in seconds (default is 30 seconds).

props.name: trackResetOnLoad
props.desc:
If set to true, form.reset() resets to the last loaded
or setValues() data instead of when the form was first created.

props.name: listeners

events.name: actioncomplete
events.desc: Fires when an action is completed.

events.name: actionfailed
events.desc: Fires when an action fails.

events.name: beforeaction
events.desc: Fires before any action is performed. Return false to cancel the action.

methods.name: add

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addForm

Add a secondary form to this one, 
Used to provide tabbed forms. One form is primary, with hidden values 
which mirror the elements from the other forms.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.desc:
Returns the fields in this form as an object with key/value pairs. 
This differs from getValues as it calls getValue on each child item, rather than using dom data.

methods.name: getValues
methods.desc:
Returns the fields in this form as an object with key/value pairs. If multiple fields exist with the same name
they are returned as an array.

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: isDirty
methods.desc: Returns true if any fields in this form have changed since their original load.

methods.name: isValid
methods.desc: Returns true if client-side validation on the form is successful.

methods.name: load

methods.name: loadRecord
methods.desc: Loads an Roo.data.Record into this form.

methods.name: markInvalid

methods.name: on

methods.name: removeListener

methods.name: render

Looks at the fields in this form, checks them for an id attribute,
and calls applyTo on the existing dom element with that id.

methods.name: reset

methods.name: setValues
methods.desc: Set values for fields in this form in bulk.

methods.name: submit
methods.desc: Shortcut to do a submit action.

methods.name: un

methods.name: updateRecord

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the checkbox receives focus (defaults to undefined)

props.name: fieldClass
props.desc: The default CSS class for the checkbox (defaults to "x-form-field")

props.name: checked
props.desc: True if the the checkbox should render already checked (defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to
{tag: "input", type: "checkbox", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: boxLabel
props.desc: The text that appears beside the checkbox

props.name: inputValue
props.desc: The value that should go into the generated input element's value attribute

props.name: valueOff
props.desc: The value that should go into the generated input element's value when unchecked.

props.name: fieldLabel
props.desc: Label to use when rendering a form.

props.name: qtip
props.desc: Mouse over tip

props.name: name
props.desc: The field's HTML name attribute.

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: invalidText
props.desc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided (defaults to "The value in this field is invalid")

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: msgTarget
props.desc:
The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description
-----------   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
qtip          Display a quick tip when the user hovers over the field
title         Display a default browser title attribute popup
under         Add a block div beneath the field containing the error text
side          Add an error icon to the right of the field with a popup on hover
[element id]  Add the error text directly to the innerHTML of the specified element

props.name: msgFx
props.desc: Experimental The effect used when displaying a validation message under the field (defaults to 'normal').

props.name: readOnly
props.desc: True to mark the field as readOnly in HTML (defaults to false) -- Note: this only sets the element's readOnly DOM attribute.

props.name: disabled
props.desc: True to disable the field (defaults to false).

props.name: inputType
props.desc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password (defaults to "text").

props.name: tabIndex
props.desc: The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo (defaults to undefined).

props.name: value
props.desc: A value to initialize this field with.

props.name: cls
props.desc: A CSS class to apply to the field's underlying element.

props.name: width
props.desc: width (optional) size of component

props.name: height
props.desc: height (optional) size of component

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.name: transform
props.desc: The id, DOM node or element of an existing select to convert to a ComboBox

props.name: lazyRender
props.desc:
True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when
rendering into an Roo.Editor, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to:
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "24", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: store
props.desc: The data store to which this combo is bound (defaults to undefined)

props.name: title
props.desc:
If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of
the dropdown list (defaults to undefined, with no header element)

props.name: tpl
props.desc: The template to use to render the output

props.name: listWidth
props.desc: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field)

props.name: displayField
props.desc:
The underlying data field name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'text' if mode = 'local')

props.name: valueField
props.desc:
The underlying data value name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'value' if mode = 'local'). 
Note: use of a valueField requires the user make a selection
in order for a value to be mapped.

props.name: hiddenName
props.desc:
If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the
field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name)

props.name: listClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '')

props.name: selectedClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the selected item in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected')

props.name: triggerClass
props.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerClass will be appended if specified (defaults to 'x-form-arrow-trigger' which displays a downward arrow icon).

props.name: shadow
props.desc: True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right

props.name: listAlign
props.desc:
A valid anchor position value. See {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for details on supported
anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl')

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300)

props.name: triggerAction
props.desc:
The action to execute when the trigger field is activated.  Use 'all' to run the
query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'query')

props.name: minChars
props.desc:
The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate
(defaults to 4, does not apply if editable = false)

props.name: typeAhead
props.desc:
True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable
delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false)

props.name: queryDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.name: pageSize
props.desc:
If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the
filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters.  Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0)

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc:
True to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus.  Only applies
when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

props.name: alwaysQuery
props.desc: Disable caching of results, and always send query

props.name: hideTrigger
props.desc: True to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field (defaults to false)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: emptyText
props.desc: The default text to display in an empty field - placeholder... (defaults to null).

props.name: fieldLabel
props.desc: Label to use when rendering a form.

props.name: qtip
props.desc: Mouse over tip

props.name: name
props.desc: The field's HTML name attribute.

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: invalidText
props.desc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided (defaults to "The value in this field is invalid")

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: fieldClass
props.desc: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to "x-form-field")

props.name: msgTarget
props.desc:
The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description
-----------   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
qtip          Display a quick tip when the user hovers over the field
title         Display a default browser title attribute popup
under         Add a block div beneath the field containing the error text
side          Add an error icon to the right of the field with a popup on hover
[element id]  Add the error text directly to the innerHTML of the specified element

props.name: msgFx
props.desc: Experimental The effect used when displaying a validation message under the field (defaults to 'normal').

props.name: readOnly
props.desc: True to mark the field as readOnly in HTML (defaults to false) -- Note: this only sets the element's readOnly DOM attribute.

props.name: disabled
props.desc: True to disable the field (defaults to false).

props.name: inputType
props.desc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password (defaults to "text").

props.name: tabIndex
props.desc: The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo (defaults to undefined).

props.name: value
props.desc: A value to initialize this field with.

props.name: cls
props.desc: A CSS class to apply to the field's underlying element.

props.name: width
props.desc: width (optional) size of component

props.name: height
props.desc: height (optional) size of component

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

events.desc: Fires when the 'add' icon is pressed (add a listener to enable add button)

events.name: autosize
events.desc:
Fires when the autosize function is triggered.  The field may or may not have actually changed size
according to the default logic, but this event provides a hook for the developer to apply additional
logic at runtime to resize the field if needed.

events.name: beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.

events.name: beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.desc:
Fires before all queries are processed. Return false to cancel the query or set cancel to true.
The event object passed has these properties:

events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: beforeselect
events.desc: Fires before a list item is selected. Return false to cancel the selection.

events.name: beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: blur
events.desc: Fires when this field loses input focus.

events.name: change
events.desc: Fires just before the field blurs if the field value has changed.

events.name: collapse
events.desc: Fires when the dropdown list is collapsed

events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.desc: Fires when the 'edit' icon is pressed (add a listener to enable add button)

events.name: enable
events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: expand
events.desc: Fires when the dropdown list is expanded

events.name: focus
events.desc: Fires when this field receives input focus.

events.name: hide
events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: invalid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been marked as invalid.

events.name: keyup
events.desc: Fires after the key up

events.name: move
events.desc: Fires after the component is moved.

events.name: render
events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: resize
events.desc: Fires after the component is resized.

events.name: select
events.desc: Fires when a list item is selected

events.name: show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

events.name: specialkey
events.desc:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed.  You can check
{@link Roo.EventObject#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

events.name: valid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been validated with no errors.

methods.name: select
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its numeric index in the list. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: selectByValue
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its data value. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: selectText
methods.desc: Selects text in this field

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.desc:
Allow or prevent the user from directly editing the field text.  If false is passed,
the user will only be able to select from the items defined in the dropdown list.  This method
is the runtime equivalent of setting the 'editable' config option at config time.

methods.name: setFromData
methods.desc: Sets the value of the field based on a object which is related to the record format for the store.

methods.name: setPagePosition
methods.desc:
Sets the page XY position of the component.  To set the left and top instead, use {@link #setPosition}.
This method fires the move event.

methods.name: setPosition
methods.desc:
Sets the left and top of the component.  To set the page XY position instead, use {@link #setPagePosition}.
This method fires the move event.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc:
Sets the width and height of the component.  This method fires the resize event.  This method can accept
either width and height as separate numeric arguments, or you can pass a size object like {width:10, height:20}.

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc:
Sets the specified value into the field.  If the value finds a match, the corresponding record text
will be displayed in the field.  If the value does not match the data value of an existing item,
and the valueNotFoundText config option is defined, it will be displayed as the default field text.
Otherwise the field will be blank (although the value will still be set).

methods.name: validateValue

if the validation fails

props.desc: The hidden name of the field, often contains an comma seperated list of names

props.name: grow
props.desc: True if this field should automatically grow and shrink to its content

props.name: growMin
props.desc: The minimum width to allow when grow = true (defaults to 30)

props.name: growMax
props.desc: The maximum width to allow when grow = true (defaults to 800)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: emptyText
props.desc: The default text to display in an empty field - placeholder... (defaults to null).

props.name: fieldLabel
props.desc: Label to use when rendering a form.

props.name: qtip
props.desc: Mouse over tip

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: invalidText
props.desc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided (defaults to "The value in this field is invalid")

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "20", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: fieldClass
props.desc: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to "x-form-field")

props.name: msgTarget
props.desc:
The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description
-----------   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
qtip          Display a quick tip when the user hovers over the field
title         Display a default browser title attribute popup
under         Add a block div beneath the field containing the error text
side          Add an error icon to the right of the field with a popup on hover
[element id]  Add the error text directly to the innerHTML of the specified element

props.name: msgFx
props.desc: Experimental The effect used when displaying a validation message under the field (defaults to 'normal').

props.name: readOnly
props.desc: True to mark the field as readOnly in HTML (defaults to false) -- Note: this only sets the element's readOnly DOM attribute.

props.name: disabled
props.desc: True to disable the field (defaults to false).

props.name: inputType
props.desc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password (defaults to "text").

props.name: tabIndex
props.desc: The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo (defaults to undefined).

props.name: value
props.desc: A value to initialize this field with.

props.name: cls
props.desc: A CSS class to apply to the field's underlying element.

props.name: height
props.desc: height (optional) size of component

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.name: listeners

events.name: autosize
events.desc:
Fires when the autosize function is triggered.  The field may or may not have actually changed size
according to the default logic, but this event provides a hook for the developer to apply additional
logic at runtime to resize the field if needed.

events.name: beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.

events.name: beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: beforeremove
events.desc: Fires before remove the value from the list

events.name: beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: blur
events.desc: Fires when this field loses input focus.

events.name: change
events.desc: Fires just before the field blurs if the field value has changed.

events.name: destroy
events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.name: disable
events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.name: enable
events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: focus
events.desc: Fires when this field receives input focus.

events.name: hide
events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: invalid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been marked as invalid.

events.name: keyup
events.desc: Fires after the key up

events.name: move
events.desc: Fires after the component is moved.

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when remove the value from the list

events.name: render
events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: resize
events.desc: Fires after the component is resized.

events.name: show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

events.name: specialkey
events.desc:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed.  You can check
{@link Roo.EventObject#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

events.name: valid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been validated with no errors.

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

methods.name: addListener
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

methods.name: applyTo
methods.desc: Apply the behaviors of this component to an existing element. This is used instead of render().

methods.name: autoSize
methods.desc:
Automatically grows the field to accomodate the width of the text up to the maximum field width allowed.
This only takes effect if grow = true, and fires the autosize event.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: clearInvalid
methods.desc: Clear any invalid styles/messages for this field

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM,
removing the component from its {@link Roo.Container} (if applicable) and unregistering it from {@link Roo.ComponentMgr}.

methods.name: disable
methods.desc: Disable this component.

methods.name: enable
methods.desc: Enable this component.

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Try to focus this component.

methods.name: getBox
methods.desc: Gets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the underlying {@link Roo.Element}.

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns the id of this component.

methods.name: getName
methods.desc: Returns the name attribute of the field if available

methods.name: getPosition
methods.desc: Gets the current XY position of the component's underlying element.

methods.name: getRawValue
methods.desc: Returns the raw data value which may or may not be a valid, defined value.  To return a normalized value see {@link #getValue}.

methods.name: getSize
methods.desc: Gets the current size of the component's underlying element.

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Returns the normalized data value (undefined or emptyText will be returned as '').  To return the raw value see {@link #getRawValue}.

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide this component.

methods.name: isDirty
methods.desc: Returns true if this field has been changed since it was originally loaded and is not disabled.

methods.name: isValid
methods.desc: Returns whether or not the field value is currently valid

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if this component is visible.

methods.name: markInvalid
methods.desc: Mark this field as invalid

methods.name: on
methods.sig: (String eventName, Function handler, Object scope, Object options)
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

methods.name: onPosition
methods.desc:
Called after the component is moved, this method is empty by default but can be implemented by any
subclass that needs to perform custom logic after a move occurs.

methods.name: onResize
methods.sig: (Number adjWidth, Number adjHeight, Number rawWidth, Number rawHeight)
methods.desc:
Called after the component is resized, this method is empty by default but can be implemented by any
subclass that needs to perform custom logic after a resize occurs.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

methods.name: render
methods.desc: If this is a lazy rendering component, render it to its container element.

methods.name: reset
methods.desc: Resets the current field value to the originally-loaded value and clears any validation messages.

methods.name: selectText
methods.desc: Selects text in this field

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: setPagePosition
methods.desc:
Sets the page XY position of the component.  To set the left and top instead, use {@link #setPosition}.
This method fires the move event.

methods.name: setPosition
methods.desc:
Sets the left and top of the component.  To set the page XY position instead, use {@link #setPagePosition}.
This method fires the move event.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc:
Sets the width and height of the component.  This method fires the resize event.  This method can accept
either width and height as separate numeric arguments, or you can pass a size object like {width:10, height:20}.

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc: Sets a data value into the field and validates it.  To set the value directly without validation see {@link #setRawValue}.

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc: Convenience function to hide or show this component by boolean.

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show this component.

methods.name: syncSize
methods.desc: Force the component's size to recalculate based on the underlying element's current height and width.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

methods.name: updateBox
methods.desc: Sets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

methods.name: validate
methods.desc: Validates the combox array value

methods.name: validateValue
methods.desc:
Validates a value according to the field's validation rules and marks the field as invalid
if the validation fails

props.name: width
props.desc: width (optional) size of component

props.name: height
props.desc: height (optional) size of component

props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.name: transform
props.desc: The id, DOM node or element of an existing select to convert to a ComboBox

props.name: lazyRender
props.desc:
True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when
rendering into an Roo.Editor, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to:
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "24", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: store
props.desc: The data store to which this combo is bound (defaults to undefined)

props.name: title
props.desc:
If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of
the dropdown list (defaults to undefined, with no header element)

props.name: tpl
props.desc: The template to use to render the output

props.name: listWidth
props.desc: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field)

props.name: displayField
props.desc:
The underlying data field name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'text' if mode = 'local')

props.name: valueField
props.desc:
The underlying data value name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'value' if mode = 'local'). 
Note: use of a valueField requires the user make a selection
in order for a value to be mapped.

props.name: hiddenName
props.desc:
If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the
field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name)

props.name: listClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '')

props.name: selectedClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the selected item in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected')

props.name: triggerClass
props.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerClass will be appended if specified (defaults to 'x-form-arrow-trigger' which displays a downward arrow icon).

props.name: shadow
props.desc: True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right

props.name: listAlign
props.desc:
A valid anchor position value. See {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for details on supported
anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl')

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300)

props.name: triggerAction
props.desc:
The action to execute when the trigger field is activated.  Use 'all' to run the
query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'query')

props.name: minChars
props.desc:
The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate
(defaults to 4, does not apply if editable = false)

props.name: typeAhead
props.desc:
True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable
delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false)

props.name: queryDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.name: pageSize
props.desc:
If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the
filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters.  Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0)

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc:
True to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus.  Only applies
when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

props.name: alwaysQuery
props.desc: Disable caching of results, and always send query

props.name: hideTrigger
props.desc: True to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field (defaults to false)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText

methods.name: select
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its numeric index in the list. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: selectByValue
methods.desc:
Select an item in the dropdown list by its data value. This function does NOT cause the select event to fire.
The store must be loaded and the list expanded for this function to work, otherwise use setValue.

methods.name: selectText
methods.desc: Selects text in this field

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.desc:
Allow or prevent the user from directly editing the field text.  If false is passed,
the user will only be able to select from the items defined in the dropdown list.  This method
is the runtime equivalent of setting the 'editable' config option at config time.

methods.name: setFromData
methods.desc: Sets the value of the field based on a object which is related to the record format for the store.

methods.name: setPagePosition
methods.desc:
Sets the page XY position of the component.  To set the left and top instead, use {@link #setPosition}.
This method fires the move event.

methods.name: setPosition
methods.desc:
Sets the left and top of the component.  To set the page XY position instead, use {@link #setPagePosition}.
This method fires the move event.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc:
Sets the width and height of the component.  This method fires the resize event.  This method can accept
either width and height as separate numeric arguments, or you can pass a size object like {width:10, height:20}.

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc:
Sets the specified value into the field.  If the value finds a match, the corresponding record text
will be displayed in the field.  If the value does not match the data value of an existing item,
and the valueNotFoundText config option is defined, it will be displayed as the default field text.
Otherwise the field will be blank (although the value will still be set).

methods.desc: Sets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.
