props.name: tree
props.desc: The tree to bind to.

props.name: field
props.desc: The field configuration

props.name: alignment
props.desc: The position to align to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to "l-l").

props.name: hideEl
props.desc: True to hide the bound element while the editor is displayed (defaults to false)

props.name: cls
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the editor (defaults to "x-small-editor x-tree-editor")

props.name: shim
props.desc: True to shim the editor if selects/iframes could be displayed beneath it (defaults to false)

props.name: maxWidth
props.desc:
The maximum width in pixels of the editor field (defaults to 250).  Note that if the maxWidth would exceed
the containing tree element's size, it will be automatically limited for you to the container width, taking
scroll and client offsets into account prior to each edit.

props.name: autosize
props.desc:
True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field, "width" to adopt the width only,
or "height" to adopt the height only (defaults to false)

props.name: revertInvalid
props.desc:
True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field
validation fails (defaults to true)

props.name: ignoreNoChange
props.desc:
True to skip the the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and
the value has not changed (defaults to false).  Applies only to string values - edits for other data types
will never be ignored.

props.name: value
props.desc: The data value of the underlying field (defaults to "")

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
"sides" for sides/bottom only, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop"
for bottom-right shadow (defaults to "frame")

props.name: constrain
props.desc: True to constrain the editor to the viewport

props.name: completeOnEnter
props.desc: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

props.name: cancelOnEsc
props.desc: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed (defaults to false)

props.name: updateEl
props.desc: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes (defaults to false)

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

events.name: beforecomplete
events.desc:
Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the underlying
field.  Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event.
Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this
event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

events.name: beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.

events.name: beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: beforenodeedit
events.desc:
Fires when editing is initiated, but before the value changes.  Editing can be canceled by returning
false from the handler of this event.

events.name: beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: beforestartedit
events.desc:
Fires when editing is initiated, but before the value changes.  Editing can be canceled by returning
false from the handler of this event.

events.name: complete
events.desc: Fires after editing is complete and any changed value has been written to the underlying field.

set a filter cannot be cleared.

methods.name: filter
methods.desc: Filter the data by a specific attribute.

methods.name: filterBy
methods.desc:
Filter by a function. The passed function will be called with each
node in the tree (or from the startNode). If the function returns true, the node is kept
otherwise it is filtered. If a node is filtered, its children are also filtered.

props.name: dataUrl
props.desc:
The URL from which to request a Json string which
specifies an array of node definition object representing the child nodes
to be loaded.

props.name: requestMethod
props.desc:
either GET or POST
defaults to POST (due to BC)
to be loaded.

props.name: baseParams
props.desc:
(optional) An object containing properties which
specify HTTP parameters to be passed to each request for child nodes.

props.name: baseAttrs
props.desc:
(optional) An object containing attributes to be added to all nodes
created by this loader. If the attributes sent by the server have an attribute in this object,
they take priority.

props.name: uiProviders
props.desc: (optional) An object containing properties which DEPRECATED - use 'create' event handler to modify attributes - which affect creation. specify custom {@link Roo.tree.TreeNodeUI} implementations. If the optional uiProvider attribute of a returned child node is a string rather than a reference to a TreeNodeUI implementation, this that string value is used as a property name in the uiProviders object. You can define the provider named 'default' , and this will be used for all nodes (if no uiProvider is delivered by the node data)

props.name: clearOnLoad
props.desc:
(optional) Default to true. Remove previously existing
child nodes before loading.

props.name: root
queryParam
props.desc:
(optional) 
Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'node')
eg. the request will be ?node=[id]

methods.name: bubble
methods.desc: Bubbles up the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

methods.name: cascade
methods.desc: Cascades down the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

events.name: append
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is appended to a node in this tree.

events.name: beforeappend
events.desc: Fires before a new child is appended to a node in this tree, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforechildrenrendered
events.desc: Fires right before the child nodes for a node are rendered

events.name: beforeclick
events.desc: Fires before click processing on a node. Return false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecollapse
events.desc: Fires before a node is collapsed, return false to cancel.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.desc: Fires before a node is expanded, return false to cancel.

events.name: beforeinsert
events.desc: Fires before a new child is inserted in a node in this tree, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforeload
events.desc: Fires before a node is loaded, return false to cancel

events.name: beforemove
events.desc: Fires before a node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforenodedrop
events.desc:
Fires when a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree for preprocessing. Return false to cancel the drop. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source OR you can supply node(s) to be inserted by setting them on this object.
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the drop.

events.name: beforeremove
events.desc: Fires before a child is removed from a node in this tree, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: checkchange
events.desc: Fires when a node with a checkbox's checked property changes

events.name: click
events.desc: Fires when a node is clicked

events.name: collapse
events.desc: Fires when a node is collapsed

events.name: contextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a node is right clicked

events.name: dblclick
events.desc: Fires when a node is double clicked

events.name: disabledchange
events.desc: Fires when the disabled status of a node changes

events.name: dragdrop
events.desc: Fires when a dragged node is dropped on a valid DD target

events.name: enddrag
events.desc: Fires when a drag operation is complete

events.name: expand
events.desc: Fires when a node is expanded

events.name: insert
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is inserted in a node in this tree.

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires when a node is loaded

events.name: move
events.desc: Fires when a node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: nodedragover
events.desc:
Fires when a tree node is being targeted for a drag drop, return false to signal drop not allowed. The dragOverEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source.
  • cancel - Set this to true to signal drop not allowed.

events.name: nodedrop
events.desc:
Fires after a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Dropped node(s).

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when a child node is removed from a node in this tree.

events.name: startdrag
events.desc: Fires when a node starts being dragged

events.name: textchange
events.desc: Fires when the text for a node is changed
